ACTOR1: Rioters (Kosovo)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Serbian Ethnic Group (Kosovo)
ACTOR2: KFOR: Kosovo Force (1999-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NATO: North Atlantic Treaty Organization; Government of Kosovo (2020-); Civilians (Kosovo); Journalists (Kosovo)
NOTES: On 29 May 2023, Kosovo Serb demonstrators gathered in front of the municipality of Zvecan to demand that the Albanian mayors that won in the local elections that they boycotted not take their offices, since they claim they do not represent them. They clashed with NATO KFOR units, both sides used shock bombs and pepper spray. 30 KFOR soldiers and more than 50 demonstrators were injured, one of whom with gunshot wounds. The demonstrators also attacked journalists from Top Channel. Their car was also sprayed with a Serbian nationalist symbol and their tires were blown out. Journalists was seriously injured.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Kosovo)
ACTOR2: NATO: North Atlantic Treaty Organization
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: KFOR: Kosovo Force (1999-)
NOTES: On 26 December 2022, unidentified perpetrators shot at the NATO peacekeepers in Kosovo, also known as KFOR, during their patrol in the north of the country in Zubin Potok. KFOR are the main security force to react to tensions in the country through a mandate by the UN Security Council. No fatalities.

ACTOR1: NATO: North Atlantic Treaty Organization
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: KFOR: Kosovo Force (1999-)
NOTES: Other: On 20 August 2022, the foreign policy chief of the European Union confirmed that NATO had increased its presence in northern Kosovo at the Brnjak border crossing by several thousand troops, in anticipation of a possible increase in tensions along the border with Kosovo and Serbia.

SOURCE: RFI; All Africa; Deutsche Welle; AFP

NOTES: Movement of forces: On 24 December 2020, a 300-strong contingent of Rwandan reinforcements had arrived in the country, coded to Bangui, to support MINUSCA.

NOTES: Around 19 December 2020 (as reported), the rebel coalition (CPC) and government forces clashed in Bossembele (Bossembele, Ombella M'Poko). Reinforcement arrived on both sides, the presidential guards and the FACA soldiers called on the air and land resources of Minusca as well as the French forces stationed in Boali, and on the rebel coalition side, reinforcements came from Bossangoa and Yaloke. No report on casualties.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka

SOURCE: Reseau des Journalistes pour les Droits de l'Homme; Corbeau News
NOTES: On 18 December 2020, armed rebels, including Anti-Balaka and 3R, clashed with military forces, including the presidential guard, and MINUSCA deployed forces in Bossembele (Bossembele, Ombella M'Poko) early in the morning. Several people are said to have died, including FACA elements and armed groups. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Movement of forces: On 18 December 2020, the UN mission to the Central African Republic (MINUSCA) deployed forces in the west of the country, in Bossemptele (Bossemtele, Ouham Pende), following an offensive by the 3R, Patriotic Movement for Central Africa, and anti-Balaka militias. This came after the militias threatened to attack the president in order to restore security in the country.

NOTES: On 17 December 2020, military soldiers and the presidential guards attacked rebel positions 3 kilometers from Bossembele (Bossembele, Ombella M'Poko) on the Bossangoa axis. A MINUSCA fighter plane was also flying over the area to inform the police. No report on fatalities.

NOTES: On 28 October 2020, Mahamat Alkhatim, the leader of the MPC armed group, surrendered with his men to the military forces and the MINUSCA in Kaga-Bandoro (Kaga-Bandoro, Nana-Grebizi). They joined the DDR process and handed over several light and heavy weapons, including mortars.

ACTOR1: Bangui Communal Militia (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: On 22 October 2020, more than 600 members of local communal militias and others with weapons agreed to hand over their arms to the MINUSCA in Bangui city (Bangui, Bangui). They handed over 24 weapons, 104 ammunition and 13 mortar shells to join a community DRR program to promote alternative livelihoods.

ACTOR1: RRR: Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: On 29 September 2020, 3R rebels clashed with MINUSCA troops in Ngaoundaye town (Ngaoundaye, Ouham Pende) following an offensive by these rebels. The UN troops managed to drive the rebels out of the town and re-establish the voting registration process for the upcoming election. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

The rebels, who used heavy weapons, were driven off by the state forces, which destroyed 3 of their bases near this town. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

The state forces drove the militia combatants out and took full control of the town. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

The latter drove the rebels out this town, an important center of cattle production. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

ACTOR2: RRR: Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation

NOTES: On 8 July 2020, suspected 3R militia rebels used an IED against a patrolling MINUSCA armored vehicle on the Baoua-Besson road, near Besson (Nana-Mambere). The vehicle suffered some damage but no fatalities and/or injuries were reported.

A MINUSCA soldier was injured, and members of the 3R were killed. According to rumours, the leader of the group was killed, but such was denied by the group. Fatalities coded as 3 and split across two events.

The ambush resulted in 5 soldiers killed, including a gendarme, and 10 injured. Six other soldiers went missing. The incident took place during the course of military operations against this militia.

No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

NOTES: On 9 June 2020, 3R (Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation) militiamen clashed with MINUSCA peacekeepers during an incursion of these rebels against a UN military base in Pougol, 30 Km from Paoua (Paoua, Ouham Pende). The rebels left 2 peacekeepers with minor injuries and 4 others disarmed before leaving.

SOURCE: aBangui; Africa 1; Corbeau News; Radio Ndeke Luka
NOTES: On 9 June 2020, a group of 3R armed men carrying heavy weapons clashed with military soldiers of the Special Mixed Security Units (USMS) during an assault of these rebels against a USMS training military base in Wantiguira village, 8 Km from Bouar (Bouar, Nana-Mambere). The rebels seized weapons and ammunitions. FACA and MINUSCA reinforcements arrived and managed to drive back the rebels, killing at least 5 and recovering part of the weaponry stolen. At least 17 soldiers were injured and 2 rebels were arrested.

ACTOR1: MPC: Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: On 8 June 2020, militiamen of the MPC (Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic) clashed with MINUSCA peacekeepers when these militiamen were robbing a NRC humanitarian vehicle in Kaga-Bandoro (Kaga-Bandoro, Nana-Grebizi). The MINUSCA managed to arrest some of the militiamen, including one of the leaders. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

NOTES: On 5 June 2020, Military Forces with the support of MINUSCA peacekeepers clashed with 5 armed rebels of the FPRC armed group in Miammani village, near Ndele (Ndele, Bamingui-Bangoran). The rebels were quickly disarmed by the military forces and then arrested.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: On 4 June 2020, Anti-Balaka armed men attempted to loot goods during an NGO distribution in Bria (Haute-Kotto), but MINUSCA forces intervened (assumed clash) and the assailants left. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

NOTES: On 10 May 2020, Anti-balaka armed men clashed with MINUSCA after seizing 3 sheep belonging to a man in Bria (Haute-Kotto). MINUSCA peacekeepers forced the assailants to return the looted livestock. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

ACTOR1: RPRC: Patriotic Movement for the Renewal of the Central African People

SOURCE: aBangui; AFP; BBC News; Corbeau News; Radio Ndeke Luka; The New Humanitarian; Xinhua
NOTES: On 29 April 2020, a large group of RPRC militiamen in coalition with MLCJ and PRNC, all of the Kara Ethnic Group, clashed with FPRC rebels, in control of the area and mostly of Ronga ethnicity, during an incursion in the centre of Ndele (Ndele, Bamingui-Bangoran). The FPRC, outnumbered, reportedly tried to fight the assailants and with MINUSCA support to protect civilians. The Government stated that 25 people were killed, including 21 civilians, while 51 were injured, but other sources reported at least 37 were killed.

NOTES: On 17 April 2020, ex-Seleka (UPC) forces and MINUSCA clashed during an attempted abduction of 3 telecom workers in Ippy (Ouaka). MINUSCA forces secured the release of the 3 men. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: On 12 April 2020, MINUSCA decided to withdraw its Temporary Operational Base (TOB) in Beboura 3 (Ouham Pende) following hostility from the local population against the base, triggered by a fatal car accident who left one civilian killed on 9 April. Authorities has warned about the security vacuum left.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Vigilante Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: On 9 April 2020, residents destroyed a MINUSCA temporary operational base in Beboura 3 (Ouham Pende) after a fatal car accident between patrolling MINUSCA officials and a woman, who died soon after. Witnesses asked officials for immediate compensation. Soon after the angry population set the base on fire and destroyed the facilities. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)

The event took place in the context of ongoing clashes between FPRC and RPRC fighters following the assassination of a FPRC colonel by RPRC members last March 2 in Bamingui (coded separately).

NOTES: On 2 February 2020, MINUSCA forces clashed with unidentified armed men at an INGO compound in Kaga-Bandoro (Nana-Grebizi). It was reported MINUSCA forces drove the perpetrators away, and neither injuries nor fatalities were recorded.

NOTES: On 27 December 2019, unknown armed persons attacked and injured peacekeepers 24 km from Batangafo, Ouham.

SOURCE: UN Panel of Experts; Reseau des Journalistes pour les Droits de l'Homme
NOTES: 8 April. MINUSCA forces engaged into an operation against local militias in KM5 neighbourhood attempting to disarm them: initial reports of 3 dead and 30 wounded (11 among MINUSCA elements). However, MINUSCA later confirmed two people were killed and 45 were injured during the operation. 8 militiamen were arrested, weapons and drugs seized. Militiamen set fire to the local police station.

ACTOR1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: Radio Ndeke Luka; Reseau des Journalistes pour les Droits de l'Homme
NOTES: On 1 April 2018, LRA forces attacked the Koubou village, Obo, taking 15 civilians as hostages and looting goods. FACA and MINUSCA forces intervened immediately after they were alerted of the attack, exchanging fire with the assailants who escaped in the bush with the hostages. One hostage died after the events. 9 hostages were freed by the LRA on 4 April.

ACTOR1: Private Security Forces (International)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: Radio Ndeke Luka; RCA (Central African Republic)
NOTES: On 13 May 2017, MINUSCA base was attacked by armed men associated to Anti-Balaka in Bangassou. MINSUCA sent helicopter and air-strikes to counter them. Civilians left the city to take shelter in church or in the countryside. 12 killed. Later on, Anti-Balaka denied their involvement in the clashes, stating that possibly foreign mercenaries have to be held responsible. In the meanwhile, the overall account of clashes grew to 32 dead and 44 wounded. On May, 18th, the Red Cross stated the dead were 115.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Suspected Abs attacked a MINUSCA convoy travelling through the village of Youngofongo between Bangassou and Rafai. The attack resulted in the deaths of five peacekeepers (four Cambodians and one Moroccan) and left another ten wounded (nine Moroccans and one Cambodian). Eight 'anti-Balaka' attackers were killed and several wounded in the crossfire, according to MINUSCA.

NOTES: Six UN policemen and four civilians were killed Friday morning during an ambush on the Bambari-Grimari axis. A child of seven was wounded and is being treated by peacekeepers Mauritanian.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: RCA (Central African Republic); AFP; Radio Ndeke Luka
NOTES: A dead city protest strike was observed in Bangui against MINUSCA during which barricades were erected on various roads. At one point MINUSCA peacekeepers deployed alongside national police personnel allegedly used tear gas and aerial firing to disperse some crowds in the Sango neighbourhood, resulting in 4 people killed and 11 others wounded, including 5 peacekeepers. A MINUSCA spokesman said that peacekeepers had not fired on civilians but had intervened to dismantle barricades manned by armed individuals. Gunfire and looting were also reported in other areas of Bangui. A partial dead city protest strike was also observed against MINUSCA in Nzako on the call of civil society groups. Only the cities administration remained closed however.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A clash broke out in Gbakomalekpa, near Bambari, after anti-Balaka forces stopped a civilian convoy carrying livestock which was protected by MINUSCA peacekeepers and demanded money, which the peacekeepers refused to pay. 2 anti-Balaka fighters and a civilian were killed, while 3 civilians and 5 peacekeepers were injured in the resulting violence.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: RPRC: Patriotic Movement for the Renewal of the Central African People
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: RPRC members attacked an IDP camp and clashed with MINUSCA forces in and around Kaga-Bandoro. A helicopter flight and reinforcements were dispatched to support the peacekeepers. At least 12 attackers and a number of civilians were reported killed in the violence which occurred during clashes between the ex-Seleka and peacekeeping forces. In total, the violence in the city resulted in 37 killed and at least 57 wounded (10 fatalities coded in another event).

ACTOR1: Protesters (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Residents of the Gbakondja Yassimandji neighbourhood of the 5th district of Bangui protested to demand the municipality provide electricity and deal with garbage collection which has become backed up in their area. MINUSCA and local police were on hand but no incidents were reported.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: After a man was killed by alleged former Seleka fighters, residents of Kaga-Bandoro stormed the front of the MINUSCA office in the town and demanded the departure of the Pakistani contingent. The protesters were dispersed peacefully by the UN.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Deployment:MINUSCA forces have been deployed to Bocaranga in the Koui area following violence by Anti-Balaka fighters under the command of Colonel Sidiki.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: The forces of minusca expelled about 200 heavily armed men from Boguila. The identity and affiliation of the armed men is not mentioned. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
NOTES: Around 35 heavily-armed former Seleka rebels were intercepted by MINUSCA in Sibut, resulting in 2 Seleka fighters killed, some injuries, and 10 captured. These were allegedly part of the group affiliated with the FPRC which illegally left Bangui the night before.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of the Central African Republic (2016-)
NOTES: Arrests: Jean Francis Bozize, son of former CAR leader Francois Bozize and defence minister in his cabinet, voluntarily handed himself in to MINUSCA forces in Bangui. An arrest warrant had been outstanding for him since May 2014 for suspected involvement in human rights abuses.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A Senegalese MINUSCA peacekeeper was killed by unidentified armed assailants

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
ACTOR2: PK5 Communal Militia (Central African Republic)
SOURCE: Cameroon Tribune; Xinhua; RFI; Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo); AFP
NOTES: Bangladeshi MINUSCA peacekeepers and national forces clashed with a local self-defense group in the PK5 area of Bangui after they allegedly attacked a police station. The results of the clash 1 peacekeeper was injured by a grenade and at least 3 fatalities were reported among the attackers. 3 people were also arrested. It was also reported that MINUSCA peacekeepers had gone to PK5 to secure the release of police officers leading to fatalities, but it was not clear whether the police station attack was in retaliation or prompted the MINUSCA action.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: MINUSCA forces arrived in Ngaoundaye following an attack by former Seleka militiamen and their subsequent withdrawal from the city.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: RJ: Revolution and Justice
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: After an ex-Seleka member attempted to stab a trader over a personal dispute, MINUSCA forces intervened and 'won the battle', arresting at least one Seleka member after the incident. More Seleka forces entered the town but eventually left after MINUSCA patrols were stepped up. The area is considered a stronghold of the RJ faction of the former Seleka.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)
NOTES: MINUSCA peacekeepers from Gabon and Burundi have been accused of carrying out 2 new cases of sexual abuse in Kemo province. Both of the victims were under 18.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: 500 ex-combatants from the Kaga-Bandoro area voluntarily gave up their arms and agreed to take part in DDR.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Morocco (1999-)
NOTES: After a communal group in Agoumar captured an LRA member, MINUSCA forces intervened when community members attempted to kill the rebel. This led to a clash, leading to at least 1 Moroccan peacekeeper and 1 civilian seriously injured. Both of those injured later died.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: Seleka Militia
NOTES: Surrender/Defect:Officers of the ex-Seleka coalition say a new battalion of Pakistani peacekeepers with MINUSCA have started forecefully disarming them in violation of agreements they had previously made with MINUSCA.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Morocco (1999-)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Women (Central African Republic)
NOTES: A Moroccan soldier based in Bangassou have been accused of sexually-exploiting a woman.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Women (Central African Republic)

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Women (Central African Republic)
NOTES: The UN Mission in Bangui received reports that MINUSCA peacekeepers sexually abused 4 girls in Bangui. Few details about the incident were released as investigations are ongoing.

ACTOR1: Government of the Central African Republic (2014-2016)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Presidential and legislative elections in CAR have been postponed until Dec.30 due to insecurity and logistical difficulties, following a recent constitutional referendum that included violent clashes.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: PK5 Communal Militia (Central African Republic)
NOTES: At least 5 people were killed and 20 injured, including 2 peacekeepers, during fighting which broke out in PK5 during voting over the constitutional referendum (split between multiple events in PK5). During the fighting, MINUSCA peacekeepers were deployed to protect poll workers and residents while they cast their votes near a school. Machine gun fire and RPG explosions were heard during the violence. In one incident, a Muslim self-defense militia fought with a group of anti-referendum former Seleka fighters outside a school where voting was taking place.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A MINUSCA peacekeeper was injured in Bria during violence that took place during the voting on the constitutional referendum.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Protesters erected barricades and gunfire was heard in 8 districts in Bangui after the announcement that former President Francoise Bozize would not be allowed to run in the upcoming elections. Local gendarmes, police and MINUSCA forces moved quickly to dismantle the barricades.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: MINUSCA forces intervened during an ex-Seleka attack on the Ngaboko IDP camp, killing 5 fighters during the clash. 2 Seleka fighters were also injured, as well as 1 peacekeeper.

ACTOR1: PK5 Communal Militia (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)
NOTES: Suspected PK5 militiamen supported by MINUSCA forces killed two people in Ngou ciment neighborhood of Bangui. Residents marched in front of the Radio Ndeke Luka office the flollowing day in protest.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Central African Republic)
SOURCE: RCA (Central African Republic); Radio Ndeke Luka
NOTES: 3 people were killed and several injured when MINUSCA and Sangaris forces attempted to dismantled barricades in the 3rd and 6th districts of Bangui and were opposed by youths from the areas who had erected them. Residents marched in protest against the move and re-erected the barricades.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Women (Central African Republic)
NOTES: HRW has reported that at least 8 girls were raped between October to December, 2015. Among them are two girls, one 14 years the other 18, were gang-raped by MINUSCA peacekeepers near Bambari airport.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: During clashes between anti-Balaka and ex-Seleka forces near a MINUSCA outpost, at least one Cameroonian peacekeeper was killed. It was not clear who killed the peackeeper.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: MINSUCA reported that a convoy it was protecting came under attack in the 4th district of Bangui, injuring 3 people, including 2 peacekeepers.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: 3 unidentified gunmen attacked a MINUSCA forces post in Damara. 1 assailant was killed when the peacekeepers returned fire, while the other two escaped.

SOURCE: Radio Ndeke Luka; Xinhua; RFI; UN (unspecified)
NOTES: 7 UN police were kidnapped by a 50 member anti-Balaka force and disarmed near Boali before being released in the evening after negotiations with the government. Armaments were also returned a week later after negotiations.

NOTES: MINUSCA and French forces clashed just outside the Sibut area with FPRC elements of the Seleka militia who were marching on Bangui. The clashes continued from Oct.10-11. Helicopters bombed Seleka positions during the fighting. 10 Seleka were killed over the 2 days of fighting.

ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
NOTES: A Burundian MINUSCA peacekeeper was killed during an attack by an unidentified group on a convoy traveling between Damaraand Ngerengou. Another was also injured by the attackers.

NOTES: Unidentified gunmen opened fire on the MINSUCA HQ in Bangui, prompting a return of fire from MINUSCA forces. The attackers then fled on a motorcycle. No casualties were reported.

NOTES: An attempt to dismantle barricades erected in the 8th district of Bangui led to a clash between the unidentified controllers of the barricades and MINUSCA elements. The violence reportedly also spread to the 3rd and 5th districts. At least 1 civilian was killed, although no official death toll was given (coded as 10 across the 3 events).

SOURCE: RCA (Central African Republic); Deutsche Welle; AFP; Radio Ndeke Luka
NOTES: A protest march was organized and a civil disobedience movement was called in response to the ongoing violence in Bangui. MINSUCA forces allegedly fired upon the several hundred marchers who were heading to the Office of the President to demand the resignation of the President with live bullets, killing 3 and injuring several, but UN sources dispute this. Most sources agree that three were killed.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)

NOTES: Rwandan MINUSCA forces were ambushed in the 4th district of Bangui by unidentified assailants armed with heavy weapons which caused 'extensive damage' to their armoured vehicles. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: MINUSCA has declared Bambari a weapons-free zone after rival militias clashed in the area.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Pastoralists (Central African Republic)
NOTES: At least 5 people were killed and 8 injured in intercommunal clashes between Fulani and Anti-Balaka in the Bria mining community. UN forces intervened to help stop the violence.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: At least 18 prisoners escaped from a central prison in Ngaragba after taking weapons from the guards. Most of the criminals are suspected to be former members of armed groups. The prison was also protected by international forces.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Rwanda (1994-)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A Rwandan soldier of MINUSCA opened fire on his colleagues, killing 4 other Rwandan soldiers, in their base in Bangui. He was also killed during the gunfight while 8 other soldiers were wounded. The reason behind the shooting was unclear.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)

ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)
NOTES: According to testimonies collected by Amnesty International, MINUSCA soldiers allegedly shot 2 civilians, one of whom died on the spot while the other died of their injuries in hospital.

NOTES: Exchanges of fire between MINUSCA soldiers and KM5 militia looking for their leader in KM5 area of Bangui after clashes that left 5 dead the day before. No reported casualty this time.

NOTES: 4 militiamen and 1 Cameroonian MINUSCA peacekeeper were killed in a clash with communal militia in the KM5 neighbourhood of Bangui as the peacekeepers attempted to arrest a former Seleka rebel commander. 8 other people were wounded according to MSF. Exchanges of fire were again heard between the two groups the following morning but no mentioned casualty.

ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)

ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
SOURCE: AFP; RCA (Central African Republic); Radio Ndeke Luka
NOTES: A group of unidentified gunmen opened fire on a Bangladeshi MINUSCA patrol in Diba, near Beloko. At least 2 MINUSCA peacekeepers were injured.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: WFP: World Food Programme
NOTES: A convoy of WFP supplies escorted by MINUSCA peacekeepers was attacked, resulting in the death of one of the drivers and injured others.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)
NOTES: MINUSCA peacekeepers arrested 4 individuals during security operations and allegedly used excessive force, resulting in the deaths of 2 of the individuals and a third taken to the hospital (specific location of the incident not given). The peacekeepers involved, 20 in all, were repatriated to their home country.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2014-2016)
NOTES: National and international forces launched an 'aggressive operation' against gunmen camped near Zoukombo who have ambushed commercial vehicles and attacked villagers in the Baboua area. 6 civilian hostages killed (circumstances unclear) and one released, one person arrested, and livestock recovered during the operation.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Republic of Congo (1997-)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)
NOTES: Human Rights Watch reported that 4 civilians were detained and severely beaten by Congolese peacekeeprs serving with MINUSCA in Mambere. The incident was allegedly related to a dispute over a woman between a peacekeeper and one of the victims. 2 of the civilians later died.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
ACTOR2: Anti-Balaka
NOTES: A Burundian MINUSCA contingent and Anti-Balaka forces reportedly engaged in a heavy exchange of gunfire in the 4th District (Boganda) area of Bangui near a high school after an allege failed arrest of a Anti-Balaka leader in the area. 2 peacekeepers were injured along with as many as 40 high school students who were caught in the crossfire. The MINUSCA forces claimed that the Anti-Balaka gunmen used the students as human shields.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Seleka Militia
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: After the end of the Bangui Forum, what started as peaceful protests to demand the release of an anti-Balaka leader and the resignation of the president turned into riots as angry anti-Balaka leaders felt their demands were not being taken into account. Gunfire was heard, grenades went off, and barricades were raised, while MINUSCA forces responded with tear gas. Some witnesses reported anti-Balaka and former Seleka protesting together.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A march calling for freedom of mobility and goods and social cohesion was organized by the NGO Search for Common Ground. The marchers walked from Independence Avenue to Koudoukou Avenue. MINUSCA and gednarmerie forces kept watch over the march.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Fulani Ethnic Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Following the arrest of 2 suspected criminals who are Muslims in the Bornu 5 area of Bangui, a group of Fulani Muslims asked for their release. MINUSCA forces attempted to intervene to ease tensions. A violent confortation followed leading to 30 injuries, damage to the vehicles of the convoy (broken windows), at least a dozen houses burned and unconfirmed reports of a death.

ACTOR1: Kaga-Bandoro Communal Militia (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: ReliefWeb; UN (unspecified); RCA (Central African Republic); Centrafrique Presse Info
NOTES: Around 400 residents of Kaga Bandoro armed with knives and other weapons attacked the MINUSCA base during protests to demand protection from armed Fulani who have recently attacked nearby villages. Gunfire was exchanged outside the base, while demonstrators threw stones and other objects at MINSUCA peacekeepers and attempted to set the camp on fire. Warning shots were fired by the peacekeepers. At least one protester was killed, and more than 12 people were wounded. Some reports have the number as high as 3.

ACTOR1: EUFOR RCA: European Union Force in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: EUMAM: European Unions Military Advisory Mission in the Central African Republic (2015-)
NOTES: The EUFOR-RCA force has withdrawn from the Central African Republic and been replaced by a training and advisory mission called EUMAM (European Unions Military Advisory Mission in the Central African Republic).

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
NOTES: French forces responded to violence by armed individuals in the Boy Rabe neighbourhood of Bangui. They came under small arms and grenade attacks. MINUSCA and Central African Republic police forces joined French forces in dealing with the violence. At least 3 students and 1 French soldier were wounded during the fighting.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A car which was discovered to have weapons in it broke down. Youths starting throwing stones at it and the occupants, which included a former Minister of Trade, before setting the car on fire. MINUSCA forces arrived to save the people on board, and fired tear gas to disperse the crowd.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Central African Republic)

NOTES: Anti-Balaka members protested against the occupation of the Court of Appeals by Muslims, leading to clashes which killed 3 young Muslims and injured 10 others, and killed 2 anti-Balaka and injured 2. International forces fired teargas to disperse the crowds, and cleared the building. The secretary-general of the Bambari young Muslims association says they were fired on by international forces.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Muslim Militia (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: EUFOR RCA: European Union Force in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A Spanish convoy of the EUFOR-RCA force exchanged fire with an armed man and a Muslim militia in Bangui. The armed man was shot and injured and one minor injury on the part of the armed Muslims reported.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A firefight broke out between the Anti-Balaka and the Cameroonian contingent of MINUSCA, which resulted in MINUSCA arresting General Andjilo of the Anti-Balaka.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)
NOTES: MINUSCA peacekeepers from DRC allegedly sexually abused 4 children at the Ngakobo camp in Ouaka prefecture between 2014-2015.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Clashes between Congolese soldiers of MISCA and Anti-Balaka left two people dead in Loppo village, near Nola. The MISCA soldiers had come to the area to encourage populations to return to their homes following prior clashes in the area.

ACTOR1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: 11 armed elements of the LRA moved into Moussa village in Mbomou prefecture and took several villagers hostage and injured others. MINUSCA troops in Rafai responded by moving into the area, resulting in the LRA elements to flee, leaving behind all hostages.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: MINUSCA arrested a member of Anti-Balaka. Displeased by this, other Anti-Balaka members exchanged fire with MINUSCA.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: MINUSCA and Anti-Balaka clashed in Nola. A peacekeeper and one civilian were slightly injured during the clash and four Anti-Balaka members were apprehended and disarmed.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Anti-Balaka elements clashed with MINUSCA troops in Berberati. One Anti-Balaka member and one civilian were killed.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Women (Central African Republic)
NOTES: A young girl was raped by a member of the Congolese contingent of MINUSCA.

ACTOR1: FPR: Popular Front for the Recovery
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Arrests: Chadian rebel Abdel Kader Baba Ladde, leader of Chads Popular Front for Recovery (FPR), was arrested by MINUSCA officers in Kabo district, close to the Chadian border.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Shots were fired between the Rwandan contingent of MINUSCA and an unidentified armed group in Gobongo and Fouh neighbourhoods. No fatalities.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A MINUSCA convoy was attacked by Anti-Balaka at Kabo village (20km from Boali). An Anti-Balaka element was killed during the exchange of gunfire while two MINUSCA soldiers were wounded.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2014-2016) Prison Guards
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Prisoners (Central African Republic)
NOTES: After a fellow inmate died from TB, prisoners of Ngaragba prison rioted against the staff. MINUSCA intervened and calmed the situation after dialogue with a representative of the prisoners. One prisoner died during the riot and 13 were injured, while one MINUSCA peacekeeper was seriously wounded, and six others injured.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Seleka Militia
ACTOR2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Ex-Seleka protested once again against the plans to relocate them to other regions of the country. Some ex-Seleka were armed, but there we no reports of any incidents. The protest was contained by Sangaris, MINUSCA and EUFOR-RCA troops.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: Radio Ndeke Luka; RCA (Central African Republic); USAID
NOTES: MINUSCA peacekeepers attempted to disarm some Anti-Balaka suspected of being thieves in Cantounier. Anti-Balaka fired on MINUSCA, leaving at least seven people dead and dozens injured.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Looting: Shooting erupted in the Camp Beal area followed by looting on the part of ex-Seleka, leading to an intervention of international forces.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Seleka Militia
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017); EUFOR RCA: European Union Force in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Ex-Seleka demonstrated in Bangui against plans to send them back to their rural homes. They barricaded the roads with pieces of iron, wood and car parts, and were armed. Soldiers of MINUSCA, Sangaris and EUFOR-RCA were deployed to contain the ex-rebel protesters. Shots were fired into the air by both sides.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Anti-Balaka stopped a vehicle and were trying to extort money from the passengers. MINUSCA intervened, and the Anti-Balaka opened fire on them.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A MINUSCA patrol fatally struck a boy who was crossing the road. This caused a crowd to form that attacked the MINUSCA soldiers. They fired into the air to disperse the crowd, but one person was struck by a bullet and killed.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Clashes between MINUSCA and Anti-Balaka. Six Anti-Balaka killed as a result, and four UN peacekeepers wounded.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
NOTES: Anti-Balaka clashed with French military and a Burundian convoy of UN peacekeepers in Bangui, resulting in 6 deaths.

ACTOR1: Muslim Militia (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: EUFOR RCA: European Union Force in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A Sangaris patrol was targeted by armed Muslims, who attacked them. A Spanish contingent of EUFOR-RCA came and opened fire to disperse the attackers, injuring two.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: Seleka Militia
NOTES: Sangaris and MINUSCA responded to attack by ex-seleka on an IDP camp; killing six on the side of ex-Seleka.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: An armed group opened fire on a UN patrol monitoring a protest, wounding six officers.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: An armed group attack a convoy of Pakistani and Bangladeshi UN peacekeepers, killing a Pakistani peacekeeper. Another peacekeeper was severely wounded, and seven more were injured.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Clashes occurred between MINUSCA and Anti-Balaka led by Andilo.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Clashes took place between Anti-Balaka and Sangaris and the Gabonese contingent MINUSCA during an attempted disarmament. Two deaths reported on the side of Anti-Balaka.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: The authority for the peacekeeping force in CAR formally transitioned to the United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (MINUSCA). The authority was previously held by the African-led International Support Mission in the Central African Republic (MISCA).

ACTOR1: Rioters (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2014-2016)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014); EUFOR RCA: European Union Force in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: People burnt down a police vehicle involved in a road accident that left three people killed due to overspeed in Malimaka neighborhood of Bangui. MISCA and EUFOR intervened to disperse the rioters.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Surrender/Defect:236 ex-Seleka based in camp RDOT disarmed and left to return home. They were accompanied by a contingent of MISCA.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: MISCA attempted to arrest a wanted member of Anti-Balaka. While pursuing him through a market they fired shots, resulting in two serious injuries to bystanders, including a 12 year old girl who was shot in the thigh.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Deployment:The advance team of the Rwanda Police peacekeepers, under Rwanda Formed Police Unit One (RWAFPU), arrived in CAR for a one-year peacekeeping mission under the United Nations Multi-dimensional Integrated mission in Central African Republic (Minusca). Rwanda is the first nation to deploy police peacekeepers under MINUSCA.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Several people were injured during a shootout between armed militants and MISCA forces in Batangafo

ACTOR1: FDPC: Democratic Front for the People of the Central African Republic
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: A highway bandit was arrested after a shootout with MISCA about 20km from Baboua. The bandit is believed to be part of the FDPC of Abdoulaye Miskine.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: Cantonnier Communal Militia (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Clashes between Anti-Balaka and a self-defence group in Cantonnier. Cameroonian elements of MISCA intervene to restore calm. One Anti-Balaka and a woman who was hit by a stray bullet were killed.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2014-2016) Gendarmerie
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
ACTOR2: Muslim Militia (Central African Republic)
NOTES: Reports of clashes between Muslims targetting the gendarmerie and international forces. No deaths reported.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
ACTOR2: Seleka Militia
NOTES: Eight people killed in clashes between ex-Seleka and Anti-Balaka on the 20th and 21st August 2014. MISCA intervened to try to calm the situation.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Muslim Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: More than 100 Muslims demonstrate outside the MINUSCA office against the death of a member of their community, who died in the incidents of 19th and 20th August. MISCA Force Commander, Brigadier General Martin chomu Tumenta, spoke with the demonstrators to calm the situation.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: EUFOR RCA: European Union Force in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: During a demonstration, EUFOR, with support from MISCA, intervened to separate demonstrators. Extremist and criminal elements, which mixed with the crowd, started to shoot. Nine people were injured.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
ACTOR2: Seleka Militia
NOTES: Eight people killed in clashes between ex-Seleka and Anti-Balaka on the 20th and 21st August 2014. MISCA intervened to try to calm the situation.

ACTOR1: KM5 Communal Militia (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: EUFOR RCA: European Union Force in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Clashes between French troops of EUFOR and KM5 gunmen over two days in PK5 neighborhood. At least five deaths reported, including a Red Cross volunteer who was trying to help the injured.

ACTOR1: KM5 Communal Militia (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: EUFOR RCA: European Union Force in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Clashes between French troops of EUFOR and gunmen from the KM5 neighborhood of Bangui over two days. At least five deaths reported, including a Red Cross volunteer who was trying to help the injured.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: While people queued at a bank to collect their wages, they felt angered that the bank clerks were not doing their work properly and for planning to close early. The group smashed the glass door of the bank. This prompted MISCA to react by firing to disperse the crowd. One man was shot in the arm.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia
ACTOR2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Clashes continue for a second day between Sangaris and ex-Seleka. 60 deaths, including two MISCA soldiers from DRC, and two Sangaris soldiers injured between 4th and 5th August 2014.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia
ACTOR2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: According to Sangaris, they were attacked by 100 heavily armed ex-Seleka. Ex-Seleka accuse the French soldiers of opening fire first and bringing with them Anti-Balaka fighters. 60 deaths, including two MISCA soldiers from DRC, and two Sangaris soldiers injured between 4th and 5th August 2014.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Surrender/Defect:MISCA begin to voluntarily disarm ex-Seleka at Camp RDOT.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Students (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: 300 students, dressed in black as a sign of mourning, organised a march to claim the right to education. The peaceful march was dispersed by the elements of Misca who fired shots and tear gas on them, to the dismay of demonstrators who wanted to submit a memorandum to the Head of State. Several students injured, including one who fell unconscious.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: EUFOR RCA: European Union Force in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Anti-Balaka, angered at the recent killing of a comrade, surround the ex-Seleka Camp RDOT. Shots were fired. Sangaris and EUFOR disperse the group.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Clashes between an armed group and Sangaris and MISCA. Four deaths on the side of the armed group.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Following the shooting of an Anti-Balaka by MISCA, Anti-Balaka take to the streets, erect barricades, and burn tyres. MISCA fire shots in the air to disperse the militia.

ACTOR1: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)
NOTES: MISCA chased some people into the bush for playing cards illegally. An element of MISCA opened fire on the players they pursued, killing one.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: MISCA approach Anti-Balaka with the intent of disarming them. Clashes occur, resulting in the death of one Anti-Balaka.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014); Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
SOURCE: Radio Ndeke Luka; RCA (Central African Republic)
NOTES: Clashes between ex-Seleka and Anti-Balaka following the killing of a motorcycle taxi driver, left at least four people killed. Dozens injured and lootings also reported in the town. Sangaris and MISCA soldiers intervened to calm the situation down.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: EUFOR RCA: European Union Force in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Looting: 14 Anti-Balaka were arrested by EUFOR and held in the Department of Research and Investigation because they were suspected of being responsible for cases of looting of the homes of local inhabitants.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
NOTES: Anti-Balaka erected barricades on Avenue des Martyrs due to discontent with the arrest of 14 comrades by EUFOR. They were later dispersed by MISCA and Sangaris.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Anti-Balaka attack MISCA in Boda.

ACTOR1: EUFOR RCA: European Union Force in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: EUFOR RCA reaches full operational capacity, now including 700 soldiers and gendarmes from France, Spain, Estonia, Finland, Georgia, Latvia, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Poland and Romania.

ACTOR1: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: An 18-hour curfew is imposed by MISCA in Carnot

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
NOTES: Anti-government protests held by armed demonstrators who shot at Sangaris troops and tried to force their way into a MISCA base. MISCA responded by returning fire, killing three.

ACTOR1: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Warning shots fired by MISCA are heard in Bangui in the aftermath of the attack on the Church of Our Lady of Fatima.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Clashes between Anti-Balaka and suspected Muslim militia near Fondo and Mbairi neighborhoods following the killing and maiming of three Muslims the day before in Bangui. MISCA reportedly intervened to disperse the groups but shots and grenades fired throughout the day.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Clashes continue between Anti-Balaka and MISCA following the lynching of a Muslim man. Five killed and many injured between 23rd and 24th of May 2014 due to these clashes.

ACTOR1: Anti-Balaka
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Clashes between MISCA and Anti-Balaka. Five killed and many injured between 23rd and 24th of May 2014 due to these clashes.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Anti-Balaka lynch a Muslim man to death. MISCA try to intervene in the lynching by firing warning shots.

NOTES: Two civilians were killed and six others wounded when Anti-Balaka ambushed a convoy of Muslim Peuls fleeing violence in Bangui. MISCA troops returned fire on the armed men but were unable to catch them.

NOTES: A Cameroonian MISCA soldier was killed in an incident in Paoua.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Fifteen Muslims armed with guns and knives started shooting at civilians in Yakite. MISCA intervened, killing three attackers and arresting three others. No civilian casualties reported.

ACTOR1: Seleka Militia

NOTES: Ex-Seleka arrived in Bouca, firing gunshots, but were pushed back by the Gabonese contingent of MISCA who were present in the town.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)

NOTES: Clashes continue between Anti-Balaka and Chadian elements of MISCA after Anti-Balaka attacked a convoy of fleeing Muslims the previous day. Casualties unknown.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: A convoy of twenty trucks that was evacuating the last 540 Muslims from Bossangoa to Gore in Chad was attacked by Anti-Balaka as it passed through Boguila. The convoy was escorted by Chadian soldiers of MISCA who were also leaving CAR, thus leading to clashes.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)

ACTOR1: EUFOR RCA: European Union Force in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Deployment:The first EUFOR RCA soldiers are deployed; they begin operating in Bangui on patrols.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Anti-Balaka attacked Dekoa, clashing with ex-Seleka in the locality, who were supported by Chadian elements of Misca from Kaga-Bandoro. Clashes last for two days. Red Cross reports 37 bodies collected, many of which were civilians hit by stray bullets.

ACTOR1: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)
NOTES: A man was killed by Chadian elements of MISCA who opened fire on him as he bathed in the Badiri River.

ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Anti-Balaka attempted to attack a man who had converted to Islam. When Burundian peacekeepers intervened, and they were fired upon, injuring one. One Anti-Balaka killed.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)

NOTES: On 2 October 2023, The FARDC, supported by MONUSCO clashed with CODECO-ALC who were resistant to the peace process in Masikini village, Walendu-Djatsi (Walendu-Djatsi, Djugu, Ituri), killing several of the militiamen and injuring about ten others. Fatalities coded as 3.

ACTOR1: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
ACTOR2: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Around 28 September 2023, CODECO fighters attacked civilians on Lala displacement site in Djugu (Walendu-Djatsi, Djugu, Ituri). No fatalities reported. Warning shots fired by UN peacekeepers forced the attackers to withdraw from the area.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo); Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo); FNJMN: Natural Judaic Messianic Faith toward Nations; EPLC: Awakening of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo (Wazalendo)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-); Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-); Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Republican Guard
SOURCE: 7 Sur 7; Actualite; AFP; Al Jazeera; AP; Deutsche Welle; Election-Net; France24; HRW; Infos Direct; Jeune Afrique; Kivu Morning Post; Kivu Times; La Libre Afrique; La Prosperite; La Prunelle; Le Figaro; Le Potentiel; Mediacongo.net; MONUSCO; Politico (DRC); Radio Okapi; Reuters; RFI; Sauti Ya Congo; Top Congo FM; Twitter; UN OHCHR
NOTES: On 30 August 2023, 51 - 108 people were killed as FARDC, including the Republican Guard, and the Police attempted to scatter a protest called out by the Guru of FNJMN sect, who claims to be Wazalendo-affiliated, in Goma (Goma, Nord-Kivu) to demand the departure of MONUSCO. 6 civilians were killed at the premises of the radio of the sect called Uwezo Wa Neno including a journalist and people invited to her radio program. Furthermore, a police officer was lynched by the protesters and FARDC set ablaze the church of the sect.

ACTOR1: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 16 August 2023, CODECO clashed against MONUSCO in Tche IDP camp (also spelled as Tchee) (Djugu, Ituri) as CODECO was attempting to assault civilians. Casualties unknown.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 16 August 2023, ADF clashed against MONUSCO in Luna (Walese Vonkutu, Irumu, Ituri) as ADF was attempting to assault civilians. Casualties unknown.

ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 15 August 2023, Mayi Mayi militia clashed against MONUSCO in Ituri (no further details), coded to the provincial capital, Bunia (Baboa-Bakoe, Irumu, Ituri) while the group was assaulting civilians. One militiaman killed and his weapon seized.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
NOTES: On 7 August 2023, MONUSCO clashed against CODECO around Drodro's hospital and IDP camp (Bahema-Nord, Djugu, Ituri) right after the group had besieged the hospital and attacked civilians in Nyali and Dzathi (coded separately). MONUSCO pushed away the assailants. Civilians and IDPs sheltered in MONUSCO's base overnight before returning home the next day. Fatalities unknown.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
NOTES: On 24 July 2023, overnight, a FARDC - MONUSCO coalition, on night patrol, clashed with CODECO in the village of Schubert located between Djugu and Mahagi territories coded to Djugu (Djugu, Ituri). One civilian was killed, and another seriously injured in the clash. The MONUSCO repelled CODECO out of the village.

ACTOR1: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 23 July 2023, CODECO clashed against the Bangladeshi battalionof the MONUSCO in Schubert, coded to nearby Nzanzibar (Djukoth, Mahagi, Ituri) while CODECO was assaulting civilians. CODECO withdrew. One civilian killed and another injured.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Defusal: On 18 July 2023, UNMAS (MONUSCO) destroyed an aircraft bomb, type FAB-500, of Russian manufacture, in a field in Kididiwe (Oicha, Beni, Nord-Kivu). The bomb had been shelled by FARDC two years ago during operations against ADF.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Non-violent activity: On 11 July 2023, unidentified armed men ambushed a UNICEF vehicle in Kwamouth (Plateaux, Mai-Ndombe). The vehicle managed to leave the area after locals discussed with the assailants. No casualties.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 17 June 2023, an unidentified armed men clashed with two MONUSCO convoys in Kimbulu (Lubero, Nord-Kivu). The armed men ambushed the convoys which shot summons in return. No fatalities reported.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
NOTES: Around 12 June 2023 (as reported), MONUSCO had been clashing with CODECO fighters, and repelling several attempted attacks by the latter, in the villages of Chusa, Djangi, Largu, Masumbuko, Saliboko, Jissa, Tche coded to Djangi (Mahagi, Ituri). Casualties unknown.

ACTOR1: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Chini Ya Kilima-FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo; CODECO-URDPC: Cooperative for Development of Congo (Union of Revolutionaries for the Defense of the Congolese People); MAPI: Ituri Popular Self-Defense Movement; Bira Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mayi Mayi Militia (Chini Ya Tuna)
NOTES: On 1 June 2023, FRPI, FPIC, CODECO -URDPC, MAPI and Chini ya Tuna signed an agreement with military and civilian authorities and MONUSCO in Aru (Aru, Ituri). The agreement includes the following clauses: the cessation of all violence against civilians and FARDC, allowing free movement of people and their goods, facilitating the return of displaced persons, no longer carrying weapons or military/police identifications, show their support to the DDR program, and not hinder the organization of upcoming elections and other events.

ACTOR1: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Mayi Mayi Militia
NOTES: Around 16 May 2023 (as reported), approximately 25 Mayi Mayi (ULPD) laid down their weapons in Diango cantonment site, 10 kilometers from Bunia (Baboa-Bakoe, Irumu, Ituri). They were armed with a dozen weapons and several ammunition. The program of cantonment was initiated by the government of DRC since April 17th and supported by MONUSCO. About 81 Mayi Mayi had laid down their weapons as well on May 5th.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Mayi Mayi Militia (FPP/AP: Popular Patriotic Forces, People's Army-Kabidon)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renove); Mayi Mayi Militia (Mayani); Mayi Mayi Militia (Kyandenga)
SOURCE: 7 Sur 7; Election-Net; La Prunelle; Politico (DRC); Radio Okapi
NOTES: Around 15 May 2023 (between 15 - 21 May), 12 FFPP/AP, NDC-R, Mayi Mayi Mayani and Mayi Mayi Kyandenga combatants, including 2 underage, coming from Kasinga, Kalunguta and Mwenda camps surrendered to FARDC around Beni (Beni, Nordth-Kivu) with 3 AK47. They integrated the MONUSCO demobilization program fifteen days later.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: On 29 April 2023, FARDC supported by MONUSCO clashed with ADF fighters in Apetinasana (Oicha, Beni, Nord-Kivu). 20 ADF fighters were killed in the clash. Four AK 47 were seized by FARDC. The FARDC also chased the ADF and regained control of the Luna-Komanda road.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: On 26 April 2023, FARDC supported by MONUSCO dislodged ADF from Apetinasana (Oicha, Beni, Nord-Kivu), following a seven day operation (six days coded separately). ADF (including wives and children) fled to the north towards Ituri province. Their camps were destroyed and MONUSCO and FARDC recovered weapons. Residents starting returning. Casualties unknown.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: On 25 April 2023, FARDC-MONUSCO clashed against ADF in Apetinasana (Oicha, Beni, Nord-Kivu) for the fifth consecutive day. Casualties unknown.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: On 24 April 2023, FARDC-MONUSCO clashed against ADF in Apetinasana (Oicha, Beni, Nord-Kivu) for the fourth consecutive day. Casualties unknown.
