They reported that these warning shots were aimed at protecting the 800 IDPs who have settled near the base and specified that there was no direct contact with the militias that fired the shots. Although blue helmets could not confirm the origin of the shots, Banyamulenge, Bafulero, Babembe and Banyindu ethnic militias are known to operate in the area.

NOTES: Movement of forces: MONUSCO deployed the blue helmets to Bijombo in order to conduct needs and risk assessments.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: On the night of July 7, the ADF attacked in Beni. The FARDC counted several deaths and a massive displacement of the population. Reports mention at least 1 FARDC killed, several ADF rebels (unknown coded as 3) and also 2 MONUSCO soldiers.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: On 6 July 2018, the ADF attacked the FARDC position in Boikene. The FARDC, supported by MONUSCO, pushed them out of the city. Two peacekeepers injured.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
SOURCE: Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo); Radio Okapi
NOTES: On 9 June 2018, presumed ADF militants launched an incursion in Ngite. They first burned 5 houses and some stalls, before clashing with the FARDC. 2 soldiers killed. 5 people were injured and reportedly one person died from the side effects of the violence (from hypertension due to the loud noises caused by the first explosions of the attack).

ACTOR1: UNMAS: United Nations Mine Action Service
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Security Measures: with support from the government of Japan and MONUSCO, the UNMAS installed weapon safes in many police commissariats and sub-commissariats across DRC. A total of 227 safes were installed, including 93 in Goma (North Kivu), 31 in Bukavu and Uvira (South Kivu), 73 in Bunia (Ituri), 24 in Kananga (Kasai Central) and 56 in Kinshasa.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 26 May. MONUSCO deployed troops to Saramabila area two days after the attack on the Banro mining site

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: On 20 May 2018, military forces clashed with presumed ADF rebels who had just attacked Mbau northeast of Beni and killed 10 civilians (coded in a separate VAC event). The clash lasted 3h and the FARDC managed in the end to repel the assailants. The MONUSCO aided during the pursuit.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 19 May 2018, people took to the streets and barricaded the routes between DRC and Burundi to protest the killing of the local chief the night before. Several tires were burned; there were many youth protesting. Some barricades were set in front of MONUSCO, but after the latter engaged in conversation, they were removed.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: 19 May. Fighting between MONUSCO/DRC forces and ADF continues in the area surrounding Beni. Causality figures not known.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 12 May. Rioters stoned a MONUSCO patrol in Boikene.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Malaika); Mayi Mayi Militia (Yakutumba)
SOURCE: Xinhua; RFI; Daily Monitor (Uganda); AFP; AP
NOTES: On 11 May 2018, a MONUSCO convoy was attacked by presumed Mayi Mayi Hapa na pale in Tanganyka province. Two UN members went missing, while the remaining 11 were safe. Another report by Xinhua mentions that 13 UN soldiers were abducted, but that 11 were released. The 2 missing UN soldiers were found on May 16. The Hapa na pale are supported by, or in a coalition with, the Yakutumba and Malaika, and the three groups are part of the CNPSC.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 28 April. A MONUSCO patrol was attacked and stoned by at least 700 civilians in the Rwangoma district of Beni city. Several Peacekeepers got injured

ACTOR2: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: Arrests: On 25-26 April, police and FARDC forces arrested 28 people in Kisangani and Kabondo accused of causing insecurity in the area.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: On 20 April 2018, ADF gunmen killed a motorcycle driver and his client close to Tungudu village in Beni territory. They were on their way to Ndalya market in Ituri. The FARDC chased and attacked the ADF forces right after the attack, killing one ADF.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)

NOTES: On 16 April 2018, the FARDC clashed with the ADF in the region of Garlic, 50km north of the city of Beni. 2 helicopters belonging to MONUSCO supported the FARDC with airstrikes.

NOTES: 14 April. FARDC units got surrounded by ADF in Mayimoya and required MONUSCO attack helicopters for support

NOTES: On 10 April 2018, the FARDC, supported by MONUSCO, recovered 10 localities, among which Gbi, Joo, Cafe and Nyamamba in Djugu, which are along the riverside of Lake Albert until Tchomia.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: LUCHA: Fight for Change
NOTES: On 26 March 2018, LUCHA militants took to the streets to protest in front of the MONUSCO offices in Goma, before police fired teargas to disperse them. 5 protesters were injured as they forced their way into the MONUSCO offices while the police was firing teargas; a police officer was also injured when he tried to fire teargas. The protesters in case wanted to leave the memorandum, which asked the UN Security Council to vote for a new resolution for its mandate in DRC, vouching to guarantee free and peaceful elections.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Mass grave: During its investigative mission on 14-22 March on the recent violence between the Hema and Lendu ethnic groups in Djugu territory that left at least 263 people killed, mostly from the Hema group, the BCNUDH identified five additional potential mass grave sites. 263 fatalities coded in previous violence against civilians events coded in Djugu between December 2017 and March 2018

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: On 17 March 2018, an armed group attacked a MONUSCO deployment in Gbi, around 14h30.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: On 17 March 2018, an armed group attacked a Uruguayan MONUSCO deployment in Djo at around 18h. 2 rebels were killed.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Movement of forces: MONUSCO has deployed more troops to reinforce the UN's presence in Djugu, Blukwa and Fataki since February 10th.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Movement of forces: on February 1, the MONUSCO deployed forces to Mweka, where militiamen close to a traditional chief are being accused of arson, and to Kakenge.

ACTOR1: Rioters (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Tensions were registered on January 31st in the periphery of Goma between South-Sudanese ex-combatants and MONUSCO forces. The former blocked roads and pelted MONUSCO forces, demanding their departure from a camp where 370 ex-combatants are living. The MONUSCO, in turn, used tear gas on the ex-combatants.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Mayi Mayi Militia
NOTES: On Saturday, January 27th, a Pakistani member of MONUSCO was killed during an operation in Lulimba against an armed group. At least another peacekeeper was injured during the attack. Later reports indicate the attackers were Mai Mai.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: CLC: Lay Coordination Committee; Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
NOTES: On 21 January 2018, protests organised by the CLC in Kinshasa (Kinshasa , Kinshasa ) were choked by police, who used excessive force. Live bullets were shot near the St. Gabriel de Yolo Sud parish (commune of Kalamu), and one protester was injured. Protesters at Saint Jean-Baptiste parish were also dispersed with tear gas and live bullets; one protester was beaten up. MONUSCO reports that 6 protesters were killed, including a 16 year old girl, along with 57 people injured and more than 100 people arrested nationwide.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: On 14 January 2018, in collaboration with the armies of neighbouring countries and MONUSCO, the FARDC regained control over the village of Mambaiko/Mamba Iko, expelling the ADF.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: On 14 January 2018, in collaboration with the armies of neighbouring countries and MONUSCO, the FARDC regained control over the village of Sesele, expelling the ADF.

ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: Around 13 January 2018, the FARDC launched an offensive in Eastern DRC. The offensive took place in the territories of Beni, Oicha and Lubero, and targeted all the armed group involved in conflict in the region, in particular the ADF.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Property destruction: A helicopter belonging to MONUSCO was attacked on January 6th, in Fizi. The attack is suspected to have been led by an armed group which is still active in the region, although no identity was confimed.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
NOTES: Agreement: an old commander of the FDLR-FOCA surrendered to the MONUSCO forces in Goma, on December 21st. The colonel Evariste Nizeyimana, known as 'Kiszito', is responsible for more than 80 people killed, some of them buried alive. He also orchestrated the burning of several villages, namely Buleusa, as well as the massacre in Miliki.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: The MONUSCO base which had been attacked on December 7th by the ADF has now been reoccupied.

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 17 December. The former leader of the FDLR Evariste Nizeyimana surrendered to MONUSCO in the Lubero area

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
SOURCE: Deutsche Welle; The New Humanitarian; UN (unspecified); Daily News (DRC); Radio Okapi; MONUSCO; AFP
NOTES: An attack by suspected ADF fighters on the MONUSCO base in Semliki in Nord Kivu in the evening of 7 December left 14 MONUSCO and 5 FARDC soldiers dead. Another 53 blue helmets were injured during the attack and reports of rebel deaths vary from dozens to 72. The attack was described by UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres as a 'war crime' and the worst attack on UN peacekeepers in the organisation's recent history.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: The MONUSCO forces repelled on December 7th an attack by the ADF on one of their bases along the Mbau-Kamango axis in Beni territory. 15 Dead.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: 07 December. In Semuliki, North Kivu, which resulted in the killing of 15 peacekeepers from Tanzania. Forty-four peacekeepers were also injured during the attack, attributed to the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF). After a lull in their activities, ADF has resumed their attacks in the area, including against civilians.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On Monday 27th, Congolese citizens protested against the presence of Burundian refugees in Kamanyola. The protesters protested in front of the MONUSCO offices, where there are more than 2,800 Burundian refugees. Protesters were dispersed by MONUSCO forces. The report mentions that a cemetery where 39 refugees were buried had their crosses stolen by the protesters as an act of provocation.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: The FARDC clashed with the ADF since Wednesday, in 3 locations in Beni (points 6, 16 and 25). A FARDC patrol got into a trap during the night, but there are not reported fatalities. The intervention from MONUSCO soldiers prevented the FARDC vehicle from being burned.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Mutiny of Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
NOTES: Clashes between Congolese troops and supporters of a renegade colonel (Abbas Kayonga) in Congo's eastern city of Bukavu killed seven people on Sunday before he surrendered and turned himself in to U.N. Peacekeepers. Seventeen members of Kanyonga's force surrendered to U.N. troops and nine others were captured by the army. A dozen weapons were captured. Two army soldiers and three of Kayonga's bodyguards were killed in the fighting and two civilians were killed by stray bullets, he said. Another later report mentions only one death for Kayonga's bodyguards but three civilian deaths.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)

NOTES: Over Oct 30th-Nov 3rd, the FARDC recovered from FRPI the 5 localities of Sorodo, Masira, Adaba, Pali and Ruzinga Mkubwa in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi in Irumu. Three suspected deaths - fatalities spread over events.

NOTES: The FRPI clashed with MONUSCO in Tshanda, 10 km away from Geti, injuring according do one source 3 blue helmets, and according to the UN only 2. 2 civilians were also hurt during the clash, which lasted 15 hours.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: A MONUSCO base in Mamundioma, Beni, was attacked by the ADF on October 9th. It was the second attack on a MONUSCO base in less than a week. There were 2 casualties on MONUSCO's side. MONUSCO immediately deployed forces with attack helicopters in order to secure the area. One report mentions that 10 people were killed and that at least 22 are missing. 12 other soldiers were hurt.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo)
NOTES: The FARDC supported by MONUSCO have taken control of Mayi Mayi positions in southeastern Lubero and in the north of Rutshuru after three days of military operations in these areas. The Mayi Mayi retracted to Kamandi lac and Shanita.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)

ACTOR1: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
ACTOR2: Civilians (International)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-); UN: United Nations
NOTES: 16 civilian UN staff of MONUSCO were taken hostage for several hours by about 530 former South Sudanese rebels at the Munigi camp outside Goma. The rebels were demanding the creation of a third country for South Sudanese opposition forces to inhabit. The staff were later released without any injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: At least one militia member was killed during a clash between as many as 100 Kamwina Nsapu fighters and Congolese soldiers in Tshimbulu. MONUSCO forces were deployed to reinforce the Congolese soldiers and also came under fire.

ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Agreement: 15 FDLR fighters, including those of Rwandan, Burundian and Congolese nationality, surrendered without their weapons to MONUSCO authorities based in Kanyabayonga in Lubero territory.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
NOTES: From 11 to 16 March, MONUSCO and FARDC conducted a coordinated operation against FRPI, resulting in the destruction of three camps in Ituri area. No reported violence.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: An Uruguayan MONUSCO peacekeeper was shot and injured by unidentified assailants in the Kasai-Central region.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: At least 10 people were injured, including a Congolese police officer and a MONUSCO peacekeeper, during clashes in Kisangani between two groups of young people related to the lynching of a thief over the weekend.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Movement of forces: MONUSCO peacekeepers have been deployed to Kananga following clashes over recent months between Congolese security forces and Kamwina Nsapu militiamen.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Mayi Mayi Militia
NOTES: At least 8 people were killed an attack by Mayi Mayi militiamen on Butembo. The fatalities included a South African MONUSCO peacekeeper, a police officer, a civilian, and 5 militiamen. At least 2 other South African peacekeepers were also wounded.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 3 ADF rebels were killed and some Congolese soldiers injured after two separate attacks at Nadwi village and 'GARLIC camp' in Beni territory. MONUSCO forces, including at least one helicopter, supported Congolese forces in repelling the rebel attack.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: As former South Sudanese rebel fighters were being escorted back to a camp in the Munigi area by MONUSCO peacekeepers after receiving medical treatment, the population of the area blocked the road over their hostility to the fighters being kept in the area and began throwing stones at them before briefly taking some DDR workers hostage. No injuries were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
NOTES: Congolese soldiers clashed with Mazembe Mayi Mayi militiamen in the Nyanzale area between Dec.4-5. MONUSCO peacekeepers came to the aid of the FARDC soldiers with heavy artillery. Casualties were not reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
NOTES: Congolese soldiers clashed with Mazembe Mayi Mayi militiamen in the Nyanzale area between Dec.4-5. MONUSCO peacekeepers came to the aid of the FARDC soldiers with heavy artillery. Casualties were not reported.

ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: After Mayi Mayi Mazembe militiamen attacked Luhanga, Congolese soldiers backed by MONUSCO responded and fought off the attackers, killing 1. They evacuated 15 people who had been wounded, although it was not clear if these were civilians wounded before the intervention or due to the gunfight between the militiamen and peacekeepers.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Benin (2016-)
ACTOR2: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: 2 Beninese peacekeepers were injured by arrows in an attack by a Luba militia in the kalemie area. MONUSCO forces fired shots into the air to disperse the militia.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Benin (2016-)
ACTOR2: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: 2 MONUSCO peacekeepers from Benin who travelled to the Muswaki area related to ongoing violence between Batwa and Bantu were injured by Batwa armed with bows. Five civilian staff members were also injured in the attack.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 14 November. MONUSCO establishes a base in Kabalo.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: A attack against peacekeepers of the Indian contingent of the UN Mission Democratic Republic of Congo has killed a 7 year-old girl and wounded 32 peacekeepers and two civilians when explosion has been detonated remotely before 6:30 local time (4:30 GMT) Kyeshero, in Goma. The source added that the 'home-made' device went off while the militaries were exercising. The nature of the blast in unknown and, earlier, some source said the explosion of a grenade was pulled accidentally by a peacekeeper in training and two of them, along with a girl, died.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 19 October. MONUSCO establishes a base at Nyunzu.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: FARDC soldiers backed by MONUSCO have engaged in clashes with ADF rebels in the south Eringeti area since the beginning of an operation against them on Aug.8, which has resulted in an unconfirmed number of ADF rebels killed (coded as 10). 3 soldiers were also killed, and another 3 wounded.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: 11 FARDC soldiers and a MONUSCO peacekeeper were wounded during operations against ADF rebels in the Beni area. A helicopter dispatched to recover the wounded came under fire and had to turn back. They were successfully evacuated the next day.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: 04 August. MONUSCO was directly targeted on August 4 when suspected Allied Democratic Forces elements fired a rocket-propelled grenade round towards the MONUSCO base in Semliki. As a result of the sustained pressure from the operations, Allied Democratic Forces elements continued to move north, including into Ituri province.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 7 people were killed in an attack by the ADF on Oicha, which was repulsed by Congolese soldiers and MONUSCO peacekeepers. Among those killed were 2 civilians, 3 attackers and 2 soldiers. A MONUSCO peacekeeper was also wounded and 3 ADF rebels captured.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
NOTES: Movement of forces: The Congolese army and MONUSCO launched a military operation, named 'Kiboko 3' against the FRPI in south Irumu, including the use of air support.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 50 people, including the South African contingent of MONUSCO and members of the Volunteer Association of the Congo (ASVOCO), took part in a peace march in Goma ahead of Nelson Mandela Day.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ACTOR2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Charles)
NOTES: 14 August. On 13 and 14 July, in response to cooperation between Congolese security forces and MONUSCO that aimed at preventing illegal activities in Virunga National Park, Mayi-Mayi Charles elements fired at MONUSCO helicopters and burned down a FARDC post near the park.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ACTOR2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Charles)
NOTES: 13 August. On 13 and 14 July, in response to cooperation between Congolese security forces and MONUSCO that aimed at preventing illegal activities in Virunga National Park, Mayi-Mayi Charles elements fired at MONUSCO helicopters and burned down a FARDC post near the park.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: 30 June. FARDC, with MONUSCO support, clashed with suspected Allied Democratic Forces elements east of Oicha. Two FARDC soldiers were killed and another two were wounded, and one MONUSCO peacekeeper was slightly injured. Three presumed elements of that group were killed and two were captured by FARDC.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
NOTES: FARDC soldiers dismantled an FDLR position in the Kazaroho area during operations supported by MONUSCO. They also captured arms and released 6 people kidnapped on the Kibirizi-Rwindi road.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ACTOR2: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renove)
NOTES: At least 7 NDC-R militiamen were killed and 11 others wounded in a clash with South African MONUSCO peacekeepers and FARDC soldiers in the Buleusa area of Walikale territory. They were allegedly trying to prevent food distribution to IDPs.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Mayi Mayi Militia
NOTES: 16 June. MONUSCO troops engaged Mayi-Mayi elements who had been trying to impede the distribution of food by humanitarians to internally displaced persons, resulting in the death of nine Mayi-Mayi elements.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: 14 FARDC soldiers and 37 ADF rebels have been killed in operations against the ADF since May (the deaths of 6 ADF rebels and 1 soldier coded in another event). 15 other rebels were captured, along with weapons and ammunitions and some roadside bombs. MONUSCO supported FARDC in these operations. One of the ADF rebels killed was the 2nd in command of the group (killed on June 13, coded in another event).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: Congolese soldiers backed by MONUSCO have dislodged ADF rebels from several camps in the area around Beni where the 'Usalama' operation is ongoing. 23 ADF rebels were also reported killed since the beginning of the operation.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: 20 May. Fighting between MONUSCO/DRC forces and ADF continues in the area surrounding Beni. Causality figures not known.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: MONUSCO forces attacked ADF positions in Beni territory with artillery and helicopters. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: 17 May. Fighting between MONUSCO/DRC forces and ADF continues in the area surrounding Beni. Causality figures not known.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: 16 May. Fighting between MONUSCO/DRC forces and ADF continues in the area surrounding Beni. Causality figures not known.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: 15 May. Fighting between MONUSCO/DRC forces and ADF continues in the area surrounding Beni. Causality figures not known.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: FARDC and MONUSCO forces have jointly launched a large offensive against ADF rebels focusing on the Eringiti territory, following recent killings by the group.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: 1 civilian was killed and 2 others wounded during ADF attacks on FARDC positions in Kwele and Budaki, 22km east of Eringeti. MONUSCO forces arrived to support the FARDC soldiers.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: MONUSCO helicopters engaged in 'several offensives' against ADF rebels in the Simulike area, northwest of Kizamba. Casualty numbers weren't reported.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: ADF forces attacked FARDC and MONUSCO positions in the Simulike area, northwest of Kizamba. The attack occurred near a bridge that led towards Uganda. Many ADF were reportedly wounded.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Dungu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: MONUSCO and Dungu local safety committee members established 'peacekeeping missions' in Kaka II and Dungu to end intercommunal tensions in the area.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
NOTES: Movement of forces: A large force of FRPI, including at least 115 militiamen, on the town of Tchekele was aborted after FARDC and MONUSCO forces deployed to the area.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Tanzania (1964-)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: Tanzanian MONUSCO peacekeepers have been accused of sexual abuse in the Mavivi area.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: A helicopter from the South African contingent of MONUSCO came under fire from an unidentified armed group as it was flying towards Goma. The helicopter was damaged but no injuries were reported.

ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Suspected FDLR rebels fired on a MONUSCO vehicle as it traveled from Luofu to Kaseke.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: About 20 ADF rebels attacked a FARDC position in Mayimoya. MONUSCO forces came to the FARDC soldiers aid and killed 3 ADF soldiers befor the clash ended.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: MONUSCO forces dislodged 'armed elements' from the Mambasa territory.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Nyatura Militia
NOTES: MONUSCO forces came to the aid of Kihondo IDP camp after Mayi Mayi Nyatura fighters attempted to rob its residents, leading to a clash.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
NOTES: Agreement: MONUSCO and FARDC agreed to resume military cooperation against the FDLR.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Movement of forces: MONUSCO has deployed additional troops to the Alimba area, specifically focusing on the DRCs border with Burundi.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ACTOR2: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
NOTES: Joint MONUSCO-FARDC operations were conducted against the LRA in Bangadi, Duru and Faradje.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ACTOR2: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
NOTES: Joint MONUSCO-FARDC operations were conducted against the LRA in Bangadi, Duru and Faradje.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda; Mayi Mayi Militia (Bakata Katanga); Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
NOTES: Agreement: 28 members of armed groups surrendered to MONUSCO forces between Jan.13-20. The 28 included 10 Raia Mutomboki militiamen, 7 FDLR, and a number of individuals from other groups, including Bakata Katanga and Kifuafua Mayi Mayi groups.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ACTOR2: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
NOTES: Joint MONUSCO-FARDC operations were conducted against the LRA in Bangadi, Duru and Faradje.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: An armed group (believed to be the ADF) fired on a MONUSCO helicopter flying southeast of Eringiti, causing some minor damage.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: In response to the attacks on Opira, FARDC and MONUSCO forces conducted artillery shelling and helicopter bombardment of ADF locations east of Opira.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: At least 2 ADF rebels were killed during a simultaneous attack by the ADF on FARDC and MONUSCO positions in the Opira area of beni territory. At least 5 soldiers were seriously injured, with 4 dying of their wounds the next day.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: A MONUSCO helicopter was hit by ADF gunfire near Eringiti. There were no casualties and little damage.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: Explosions were heard around Beni territory, which were attributed to operations conducted by FARDC and MONUSCO forces against ADF rebels.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
NOTES: FARDC soldiers supported by MONUSCO air forces destroyed an FRPI camp in the Ituri area.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
NOTES: According to a FARDC spokesman, FARDC soldiers supported by MONUSCO forces have engaged in attacks against FRPI positions in the localities of Mukato, Mabili, Tchanda, and Avelulu Semuliki in Ituri territory. No casualties have been reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: Following airstrikes on ADF positions, fierce clashes took place between FARDC/MONUSCO and ADF forces a few kilometres southeast of Eringeti. A spokesman for the UN Secretary-General said at least 13 ADF fighters were killed.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: MONUSCO carried out airstrikes on several ADF rebel positions with helicopters in Beni territory following an attack on one of their camps over the weekend. The UN forces said they had tracked down the rebels that had attacked them on Nov.29-30.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
SOURCE: AP; Le Potentiel; MONUSCO; Radio Okapi; Xinhua
NOTES: ADF rebels dislodged FARDC soldiers from at least part of Eringeti on Nov.29 before being pushed out a few hours later on Nov.30. The rebels attack stretched from Makembi to Eringeti and simultaneously targeted a FARDC position, a MONUSCO base, a hospital in Eringeti, and the office of the PNC in Beni territory. 1 UN peacekeeper, 7 soldiers, 10 civilians and 21 rebels were killed, while 1 peacekeeper and 4 soldiers were injured. 5 more people believe to have been killed during the fighting were found a few days later. During the violence at least 43 homes were also burned. At least 2,000 people ahve fled following the fighting.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 5 people were killed during an attack by ADF rebels on FARDC positions. The FARDC soldiers were reinforced by MONUSCO forces during the fighting.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: FARDC and MONUSCO forces launched a joint offensive against the ADF in the Beni territory, including attacks on ADF forces in the Eringeti and Oicha areas with heavy weapons. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: FARDC and MONUSCO forces launched a joint offensive against the ADF in the Beni territory, including attacks on ADF forces in the Eringeti and Oicha areas with heavy weapons. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: NDC: Nduma Defence of Congo
NOTES: MONUSCO airstrikes have continued in the Pinga area, targeting the NDC.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ACTOR2: NDC: Nduma Defence of Congo
NOTES: MONUSCO airstrikes have been launched in the Pinga area, in coordination with ground operations by FARDC, targeting the NDC. They claim to have killed 1 member of an armed group, and injured at least 4 others, and to have not caused any civilian casualties. Other sources claimed 4-5 civilians had been killed.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
NOTES: During ongoing operations by FARDC soldiers and the APCLS, the commander of a MONUSCO operational base was wounded during a patrol.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
NOTES: Agreement: A Raia Mutomboki militia leader, Ngoa Bisire, surrendered to MONUSCO forces in Walikale territory along with his dependents.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: MONUSCO set up a temporary base near Ntoto in an attempt to stabilize the region.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Following an attack on a motorcycle, ADF rebels clashed with a joint FARDC-MONUSCO force on the Semuliki River bridge. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
NOTES: On 16 June 2015, it was reported that heavy fighting had been ongoing in the Walendu Bindi area between FARDC soldiers and FRPI militiamen for the past 10 days, resulting in over 17,000 displaced. Fighting is part of a joint operation with MONUSCO forces.

NOTES: Ongoing fighting between FARDC soldiers and FRPI militiamen has been reported in the Walendu Bindi chieftaincy. The fighting is part of joint operations with MONUSCO forces.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
NOTES: Official sources have claimed that 34 FRPI militiamen have been killed, 27 wounded, and 4 captured since the beginning of the military operations against them launched by FARDC and MONUSCO forces, with the fighting occurring in the Walendu Bindi area. They also claim 4 FARDC soldiers killed and 13 injured. Fatalities divided from 3/06 to 10/06.

ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
NOTES: FARDC soldiers engaged in an offensive against all FRPI positions in Aveba, successfully dislodging them and capturing the area, reportedly causing heavy casualties. MONUSCO helicopters and peacekeepers patrolled during the operation to ensure the safety of civilians.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
NOTES: 2 Tanzanian MONUSCO peacekeepers were killed and 26 others injured in an ambush by alleged ADF rebels near the Mavivi Mayimoya intersection in the Oicha area near where a helicopter was attacked the day before. 4 peacekeepers who went missing during the attack were later found. However, a UN group of experts report accuses Congolese soldiers of causing the casualties, as they believed the Tanzanian peacekeepers had been supplying weapons to the ADF.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: A MONUSCO helicopter was fired at by unidentified gunmen from a field near Oicha. No casualties were reported, but bullet holes were observed on the helicopter.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 3 sub contractors with the UN anti mine service working with MONUSCO were kidnapped by an unidentified group in Kibumba, a farming community on the Rwandan border 30km north of Goma. The 3 contractors were later released without injuries.

ACTOR1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Charles)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Shetani)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: The Charles and Shetani Mayi Mayi militias attacked the MONUSCO intervention brigade in the Kisharo area, which responded. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Uganda)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019); MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-); Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
NOTES: A group of armed men killed 15 people in a nightclub, including an official of MONUSCO of Indian nationality, 2 FARDC soldiers and 1 police officer. Others were injured.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
NOTES: Clashes occur between demonstrators, who threw stones, and the police during protests against the proposed electoral law. The crowd also attacked two MONUSCO peacekeepers, injuring one. Some demonstrators were wounded and others arrested alongside opposition political leaders, including Rubens Mikindo, federal leader of the Union for Social Progress and Democracy [UDPS] in the east; Christian Badose, Ecide parties spokesman; Leon Tembo, Federal Chairman of the Union for the Congolese Nation [UNC] in the east and Jean Baptiste Kasekwa, Ecide parties executive secretary in eastern DRCongo.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
NOTES: Fighting began between FARDC soldiers and FRPI militiamen in the village of Aveba, and spread to other villages in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi (in Ituri), including Tchekele, Kaswara and Bavi. Thousands of people were displaced during the fighting. In Aveba, UN helicopters assisted the Congolese forces, and at least 14 FRPI and 6 FARDC soldiers were reported dead in Aveba.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: On 10 January 2015, FARDC and MONUSCO forces took control of the Pilot and Issa camps of the ADF in Virungu National Park, near Halungupa (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
NOTES: FARDC and MONUSCO soldiers have recovered all bases controlled by the FNL on the Uvira plateaus, and specifically around the town of Ruhoha. No casualties were taken by the joint forces, while casualties for the FNL were not reported. Provisional casualties were announced at 2 FNL fighters dead and 29 wounded during the operation.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: FARDC and MONUSCO soldiers have taken control of Mavume, 'an important position of the ADF', after heavy fighting with the rebels. 11 rebels were killed during the fighting and 3 FARDC soldiers were injured.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
NOTES: On 3 January 2015, FARDC and MONUSCO forces regained control of the town of Abia (Beni, Nord-Kivu) in Virunga National Park northeast of Beni, after heavy fighting with the ADF. 5 rebels were killed and 4 others injured.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
NOTES: Angry residents of Manzobe and Idohu armed with knives and stones marched to demand the release of two people imprisoned as suspects in a recent ADF-NALU attack. They attacked the police station to attempt to release the two, then went to the MONUSCO camp in Idohu and threw projectiles at the peacekeepers, who fired into the air to disperse them. 1 person was killed by a stray bullet.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Movement of forces: A joint operation by FARDC and MONUSCO forces has been launched to track down ADF-NALU rebels and stop the killings in the east.

ACTOR1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Agreement: Over 600 FDLR rebels have surrendered with their dependents and reported to camps set up by the UN, and have been transferred to the main transit centre in Kisangani.

ACTOR1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: A MONUSCO police patrol was ambushed near Beni by ADF-NALU. No MONUSCO officers were injured.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: A MONUSCO convoy made up of Indian policemen was attacked by unidentified gunmen. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: MONUSCO has claimed that the Tanzanian peacekeepers were attacked by taxi drivers when they attempted to remove a barricade, forcing them to fight them off, leading to 1 of the taxi drivers being killed by a stray bullet, although this was not apparent when they left the scene. A civil society source told AFP that the Tanzanian peacekeepers 'got out of their jeep and fired at close range on a crowd of motorbike riders blocking their passage' killing 1.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo)
NOTES: 2 youths who were part of a self-defense brigade were killed when protesters intercepted a joint patrol of FARDC and MONUSCO soldiers near Oicha. The soldiers fired warning shots to disperse the hostile youth armed with machetes, spears and stones. 3 people were then shot by the soldiers, and 2 died.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Movement of forces: The UN mission in Ituri has said that 'the special forces, the intervention brigade, and the brigade of Ituri are being deployed in combat position to neutralize' the leader of the FRPI.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ACTOR2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Sisawa)
NOTES: MONUSCO and government forces regained control of Lugunga locality, 32km N of Shabunda, from Mai Mai Raia Mutomboki-Sisawa faction.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: NDC-C: Nduma Defense of Congo (Cheka)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NDC: Nduma Defence of Congo
NOTES: Government forces, supported by MONUSCO, launched operations against Mai Mai Cheka-NDC forces in Biruti locality, Wakilale, capturing arms and munitions.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: MONUSCO discovered an arms cache near Kingi locality, Masisi territory, including 13 AK-47s, rocket launchers, and more than 1,200 cartridges.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Mayi Mayi Militia (PARECO)
NOTES: Military and MONUSCO forces carried out operations against Mai Mai PARECO forces around Nyanzale. 2 militia members were apprehended.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: NDC-C: Nduma Defense of Congo (Cheka)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NDC: Nduma Defence of Congo
NOTES: Military and MONUSCO forces carried out operations against Mai Mai Cheka-NDC forces in Mabele, NE of Makana. One militia member was apprehended.

The crowd was apparently protesting against attacks in the region carried out by Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda rebels, Nesirky told a briefing.The UN mission in DR Congo reported that 'elements' of a Mai-Mai group, the Rai Mutomboki, 'may have been part of the protest and may have fired on the peacekeepers,' The Rai Mutomboki are an armed self-defense group.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Lobala Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: Democratic Republic of Congo forces exchanged fire on Sunday with around 100 tribal insurgents in Mbandaka in Equateur. A UN soldier from Ghana was killed. The assailants received support from former soldiers of the DSP (Praetorian Guard of late President Mobutu), elements of the former army of Zaire, the DPP (personal bodyguards of former Deputy President Jean-Pierre Bemba currently in detention at the International Criminal Court) and a few demobilized persons. The assailants also claim to be part of the Liberation Movement of Independent Allies, whose chairman is Ibrahim Mangbama and its military chief Undjani, a son of Ibrahim. These names were mentioned at the start of the insurrection in Dongo in October 2009.

MONUC troops occupied the base. The clash occurred as MONUC tried to investigate reports of a mass grave holding victims of the militia, including child combatants allegedly killed when they wanted to give up their weapons under a U.N.-led disarmament campaign. 100 militiamen fled to nearby forests.

ACTOR1: UNFICYP: United Nations Peacekeeping Force in Cyprus
ACTOR2: Civilians (Turkey)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Northern Cyprus (2020-); Turkish Ethnic Group (Cyprus)
NOTES: On 12 September 2023, members of UNFICYP punched Turkish soldiers of the Security Forces Command (GKK), who were clearing a military area near Ledras palace in Nicosia. According to the Turkish side, the area used to be disputed, but now belongs to Northern Cyprus. UNFICYP spokesperson Aleem Siddique said that UNFICYP was aware of the allegations and continued its investigation.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Northern Cyprus (2020-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Northern Cyprus (2020-); Labor Group (Cyprus); Turkish Ethnic Group (Cyprus)
ACTOR2: UNFICYP: United Nations Peacekeeping Force in Cyprus
NOTES: On 18 August 2023, in an escalation of tensions in Cyprus, around 24 angry Turkish Cypriots, including Turkish Cypriot military and police in plain clothes, punched and kicked 12 UNFICYP soldiers who obstructed crews working on a road that would encroach on the United Nations-controlled buffer zone near the bi-communal village of Pyla. The Slovak and British U.N. peacekeepers linked arms to hold the Turkish Cypriots back, but received blows to the face. The work crews used tractors and heavy machinery vehicles to drag and ram the U.N. vehicles out of the way, damaging them to the point that they were undrivable. 4 peacekeepers were injured, 3 of which were hospitalized. Turkish Cypriot police claimed 8 of their officers were beaten. The road would give Turkish Cypriots direct access to Pyla by circumventing a British Bases checkpoint.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Cyprus)
ACTOR2: UNFICYP: United Nations Peacekeeping Force in Cyprus
NOTES: On 21 May 2022, a UN patrol vehicle of the Peacekeeping Force in Cyprus (UNFICYP) encountered a vehicle in the buffer zone and when they approached it for an inspection the driver fled towards Geri/Yeri in the Republic of Cyprus. During the car chase that followed, the perpetrators shot at the peacekeepers with a hunting rifle. The UN vehicle was damaged. There were no injuries. The Republic of Cyprus opened an investigation.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Cyprus)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Cyprus)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNFICYP: United Nations Peacekeeping Force in Cyprus (1964-)
NOTES: On 1 August 2021, unidentified perpetrators attacked a young UNFICYP peacekeeper in Pafos, who was on short leave from his unit, and beat him on his head and other parts of his body. He was found severely beaten and he was transferred to hospital. There was likely a fight, but the peacekeeper was not able to describe the circumstances of his attack because he had sustained a broken jaw.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Cyprus)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Journalists (Cyprus); Labor Group (Cyprus); Police Forces of Northern Cyprus (2015-2020); Teachers (Cyprus); Turkish Ethnic Group (Cyprus); UCN: Unite Cyprus Now
ACTOR2: UNFICYP: United Nations Peacekeeping Force in Cyprus (1964-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Cyprus (2013-2023)
NOTES: On 9 March 2020, Turkish Cypriot unionists of teachers' and journalists' associations and other labor groups, as well as the bi-communal group Unite Cyprus Now, demonstrated at the Lidras (Lokmaci) crossing in Nicosia against the closure of four crossing points from the South to the North due to the coronavirus. At the same time, plain-clothes and uniformed police of Northern Cyprus pushed about 50 UNFICYP officers back into the buffer zone, following a dispute over area of jurisdiction. UN officers joined the Greek Cypriot police after violent demonstrations in previous weeks.

ACTOR1: Hezbollah
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Rioters (Lebanon)
ACTOR2: UNIFIL: United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (1978-)
NOTES: On 14 December 2022, two gunmen presumably belonging to Hezbollah shot at a UNIFIL patrol that bypassed Aaqbiyeh village (Sayda) by mistake, killing 1 UNIFIL member and injuring 3 others, including 1 who is in critical condition. The shooting happened after rioters from the town surrounded one of the vehicles that got separated from the other. The vehicle crashed and flipped while trying to escape. A local was hit by the vehicle as it tried to escape and was lightly injured. A Lebanese court charged seven people involved in the incident and it was deemed as not premeditated by Lebanese authorities. Hezbollah has denied any involvement in the attack. Tensions in recent months have increased between UNIFIL and locals from the south which is a Hezbollah stronghold. On 1 June 2023 a military judge issued an indictment accusing 5 members of Hezbollah including 1 who was arrested.

ACTOR1: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2021-)
ACTOR2: CSP: Permanent Strategic Framework
SOURCE: aBamako; Facebook; FAMAMali; Le Pays Dogon; Mali Jet; Twitter; UN MINUSMA
NOTES: Movement of forces: On 31 October 2023, MINUSMA left the base in Kidal (Kidal, Kidal) as part of the mission's withdrawal. FAMa criticized the withdrawal in a statement saying that it had not been retroceded to the FAMa as stipulated in the timetable for the occupation of MINUSMA rights-of-way by the FAMA. The CSP-PSD stated that the base is now under its control, along with the airport, following the departure of MINUSMA. In a press release, MINUSMA stated that it has been forced to destroy and decommission sensitive equipment belonging to troop- and police-contributing countries and to the United Nations. This measure was taken in accordance with UN rules and procedures, as the 200 trucks on standby in Gao since September 24 were not authorized to move to Tessalit, Aguelhok and Kidal to collect the said equipment for shipment out of Mali. The departure from Kidal marks the closure of the eighth of a total of 13 MINUSMA bases in central and northern Mali, as well as in the capital, Bamako.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Wagner Group; MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2021-)
SOURCE: AFP; Al Zallaqa; AP; FAMAMali; Koro Kibaru; Ministry of Territorial Administration and Decentralization - Mali; Sahelien; Studio Tamani; Twitter; Undisclosed Source; Whatsapp; Xinhua
NOTES: On 22 April 2023, JNIM militants executed a complex attack involving three suicide car bombs (SVBIEDs), targeting FAMa and Wagner positions at the airport in the town of Sevare (Mopti, Mopti). Malian TB2 Bayraktar drones carried out airstrikes, which led to the premature detonation of two SVBIEDs. The explosions caused extensive damage to the IDP site, a gas station, and 20 buildings destroyed and many civilians houses that collapsed, many with occupants inside. Senegalese peacekeepers repelled attackers who had encircled the airport. 28 militants and 10 civilians were killed, and 61 civilians were wounded, according to a government statement. Local sources indicated that five FAMa soldiers were killed and some described as militants killed were IDPs including children, while the head of Wagner denied any losses in Wagner ranks. JNIM claimed responsibility and acknowledged 15 killed in its ranks including suicide bombers and members of the assault squad. 43 fatalities coded.

JNIM claimed responsibility and stated that the group had fired both mortar shells and rockets.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of France (2017-)
NOTES: On 14 April 2018, presumed JNIM militants carried out a multi-pronged attack against the Timbuktu Airport which harbors MINUSMA peacekeepers and French Barkhane forces. The attack involved a mortar barrage, explosives-laden vehicles and militants including some equipped with explosive belts, the battle took place for more than three hours, at least two SVBIEDs were detonated and one immobilized. French military aviation assets were deployed from Gao and Niamey including fighter jets and helicopters carrying commandos, when the battle had ended had at least 15 militants and 1 peacekeeper been killed, 7 peacekeepers, 7 Barkhane soldiers and two civilians had also been wounded, some severely.

ACTOR1: Ansar Dine
ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
SOURCE: AFP; Long War Journal; Al Akhbar (Egypt)
NOTES: A UN peacekeeper from Togo and two Malian civilians were killed Sunday at around 10:30 am (1030 GMT) when a MINUSMA logistics convoy was the target of a complex attack 45 kilometres (30 miles) north of Douentza, in the Mopti region. After a mine or improvised explosive device was detonated and the attackers opened fire on the convoy. Many sources reported Ansar Dine has claimed the responsibility while on Nov. 8 the Al-Akhbar website reports El Mourabitoune has also claimed responsibility for detonating a bomb that targeted Malian army truck although there are no more confirmations about.

ACTOR1: Islamist Militia (Mali)

ACTOR1: Ansar Dine
ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Chad (1990-2021)
NOTES: Ansar Dine fighters claimed a Grad rocket attack on a UN base in the Aguelhok area. No casualties were reported but a truck was destroyed. A second round of firing using mortars later in the day did no damage. After the first round of shelling, a Chadian patrol sent out to find the culprits hit an IED claimed by Ansar Dine. One peacekeeper was killed in the blast and at least 5 were seriously wounded; one later died of his injuries. Finally, an ambulance belonging to the Chadian MINUSMA contingent was hit by an IED as it went to pick up injured from the earlier IED. 8 people were injured during the events in total.

ACTOR1: MUJAO: Movement for Unity and Jihad in West Africa
ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
NOTES: The MINUSMA base at Aguelhoc was destroyed over two days by at least 9 rocket strikes allegedly carried out by Ansar Dine, however an Islamist militant connected to MUJAO has claimed responsibility for the attack. There were no reported casualties.

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
