ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-2022)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Civilians (Somalia); Government of Somalia (2017-2022); UNSOS: United Nations Support Office in Somalia
NOTES: On 9 March 2021, Al Shabaab militants fired at least six mortar rounds, targeting AMISOM, FGS international partners, and the UN compound in Aden Adde International Airport in Mogadishu - Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: Civilians (Somalia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNSOS: United Nations Support Office in Somalia
NOTES: On 1 January 2019, Al Shabaab fired at least seven mortar rounds at UN Support Office in Somalia (UNSOS/M) compound near Mogadishu International Airport in Wadajir District. At least four people were injured by the blasts inside of the compound.

ACTOR1: EU NAVFOR: European Union Naval Force Somalia (2008-)
ACTOR2: Pirates (Somalia)
NOTES: European naval aircraft fired at pirate-owned supplies on the Somali coastline for the first time since the European Union authorized such strikes.

ACTOR1: EU NAVFOR: European Union Naval Force Somalia (2008-)
NOTES: EU NAVFOR forces rescued an Iranian fishing dhow being used by pirates as a mothership.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On 28 February 2022, unknown gunmen fired upon a convoy of WFP vehicles travelling under the protection of UNMISS peacekeepers at an unspecified location described as being 30km from Gadiang (Twic East county, Jonglei state), wounding one peacekeeper. Note that incident may have occurred in south-western Uror county on the road to Akobo, though there are no verifiable locations in this area.

ACTOR1: Rioters (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Dinka Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Labor Group (South Sudan); Ruweng Clan Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Aid Workers (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
SOURCE: Catholic Radio Network; UNOCHA; Radio Tamazuj
NOTES: On 24 April 2021, approximately 50 youth (presumed to be Ruweng Dinka) demonstrated against unemployment at an international NGO compound in Jam Jang in the disputed Ruweng Administrative Area (Pariang county, Unity state). The demonstrators forced their way into the compound and attacked aid workers, wounding several (one seriously). UNMISS peacekeepers intervened, and have increased their presence in Jam Jang.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Ethiopia (2018-); Tigray Ethnic Group (Ethiopia); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Ethiopia (2018-); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On 22 February 2021, 15 Tigrayan ENDF soldiers from UNMISS engaged in a fist fight with their colleagues at Juba airport (Central Equatoria state), before their flight to Ethiopia. The Tigrayan soldiers were reported to have been concerned at the prospect of returning to Ethiopia, and have been granted asylum in South Sudan with the assistance of UNHCR.

ACTOR1: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (South Sudan)
NOTES: Around 16 December 2020 (week of), UNMISS clashed with six gunmen who were attempting to loot an NGO compound in Leer town (Unity state). Police subsequently engaged the gunmen, and advanced alongside UNMISS forces (who appear to have provided police with transportation in an UNMISS APC) to pursue the gunmen. During the pursuit, UNMISS and police engaged a second armed group, whom they recovered 12 cows from. No injuries or fatalities occurred.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
LOCATION: UNMISS Rubkona Protection of Civilians site
NOTES: On 22 October 2020, residents of the UNMISS PoC site in Rubkona (Unity state) reported seeing five men in SSPDF uniform (and coded as such) firing weapons at UNMISS peacekeepers guarding the base, after they were refused entry. No injuries were reported. There is no further information.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
ACTOR2: Civilians (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
LOCATION: UN House/UN Protection of Civilians Site
NOTES: On 7 April 2020, unspecified security forces (presumed to be army, given their recent activity in the same location) assaulted a South Sudanese employee of UNMISS at UN House on the outskirts of Juba, preventing them from entering the compound. The attacks come as SSPDF were reported to have been prevented IDPs from leaving the camp, having accused them of being infected with coronavirus.

ACTOR1: Rioters (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Nuer Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); Vigilante Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On 22 November 2019, IDP youths attacked UN staff, peacekeepers and vehicles at the Bentiu PoC site (Unity state), as the UN were meeting with the family who had lost their relative during the previous days violence. Two UNMISS vehicles were torched, two civilian staff member and a Ghanian peacekeepers were wounded. Youth were dispersed by warning shots after they attacked two guard posts. .

ACTOR1: Rioters (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Nuer Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On 21 November 2019, two groups of drunken IDP youths clashed in the Bentiu PoC site (Unity state). UNMISS police attempted to separate the clash, prompting the youths to turn on the police. 2 youths were killed (the sources imply they were killed by other youth), and five UNMISS police were injured.

ACTOR1: Rioters (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); Women (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On 3 September 2019, IDPs (largely comprising women and children) gathered in the UN PoC site in Juba, in a bid to stop UN Police from arresting men involved in rebel activities. A clash between demonstrators and UN Police was reported, which reportedly led to UN Police withdrawing.

ACTOR1: Rioters (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Private Security Forces (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: Private Security Forces (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On 23 June 2019, striking security guards (likely from Insight security, and coded as such) demonstrated at the UN compound in Juba. Some of the demonstrators threw stones at what the source describes as two 'male national UN guards', who were both injured and received medical treatment.

ACTOR1: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
ACTOR2: Civilians (South Sudan)
NOTES: On 19 January 2019, a UN peacekeeper shot and killed two South Sudanese labourers inside the UN base in south-western Juba. At present, there is no information as to the motive for the killing.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On 29 December 2018, an armed group attacked an unspecified area(s) along the Yei-Kaya road. An unspecified number of UNMISS personnel (nationality unspecified) were reported to have been abducted, and held for ranson, whilst looting of civilian homes also took place. The two factions of the SSNMC (one of which has joined the current peace agreement, the other breakaway group which has not) accused one another of being behind the attack (for the time being, an UAG is coded).

ACTOR1: Protesters (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Private Security Forces (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On 16 October 2018, security guards employed by Warrior Security (recently acquired by Insight) protested in Juba, over unpaid benefits, a desire for increased wages, and the terms of the new contracts soon to be introduced as a result of the takeover. The guards locked the gates to the UNMISS compound in Juba.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On 15 September 2018, an officer with the NSS fired at an UNMISS convoy in Yei (Central Equatoria), wounding a Nepalese peacekeeper. The soldier then fled into the crowd, and was arrested and placed into military detention on or before September 20th. The convoy was collecting water for the UNMISS base in Yei.

ACTOR1: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
ACTOR2: Civilians (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan)
NOTES: Displacement: On and before September 3rd, UNMISS relocated around 3,500 civilians (mostly women and children) from the PoC site to the suburb of Mangateen in Juba. No incidents were reported. This follows clashes in the PoC site in the month of August.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On 26 June 2018, UNMISS peackeepers escorting humanitarian workers from Yei to Lasu refugee camp in Central Equatoria (coordinates for Lasu used, note that no precise location on the road has been provided), near the border with DR Congo, were ambushed by unknown gunmen. One Bangladeshi peacekeeper was killed, and UNMISS forces returned fire on the attackers.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On 8 June 2018, UNMISS peacekeepers were fired upon in Rubkuay (Mayendit county, Unity state) by 80 to 100 armed men (who were later confirmed to be SPLA soldiers), and returned fire on the attackers. Casualties unknown.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On 4 June 2018, an unidentified armed group attacked a convoy consisting of UNMISS peacekeepers and civilians in the area of Rubkuay (Mayendit county, Unity state). Casualties unknown.

ACTOR1: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: UNMISS opened new bases in Akobo and Yei to deploy peacekeepers on a weekly basis to protect civilians and facilitate the delivery of humanitarian aid to people in need. This coincided with the arrival of forces from the Regional Protection Force.

ACTOR1: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: UNMISS opened new bases in Akobo and Yei to deploy peacekeepers on a weekly basis to protect civilians and facilitate the delivery of humanitarian aid to people in need. This coincided with the arrival of forces from the Regional Protection Force.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Non-violent activity: Stand-off between a group of 30 armed militants and UNMISS peacekeepers in Juba. The gunmen had entered a restricted, weapons-free zone, and were chasing civilians away. When the peacekeepers arrived they began firing shots in the air and aiming their weapons at some of the peacekeepers. After negotiations, they retreated.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: 09 December. Two UNMISS civilian contractor trucks were fired upon by unidentified armed group near Cueicok, Mayom Payam, in Rumbek Centre County.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: In Bentiu in November, armed groups exchanged fire near the eastern side of the UNMISS protection of civilians site, with some rounds fired directly towards UNMISS military personnel, who returned fire.

ACTOR1: Rioters (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Aid Workers (South Sudan); Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Around 100 angry protesters at the Juba IDP camp demonstrated carrying anti-government slogans and destroyed the offices of a humanitarian organisation (ACTED) in the camp, accusing UN officials of stopping them from meeting the US Ambassador during her visit to the camp. UN security guards fired tear gas to disperse the crowd.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: A force of 100 NSS officers stopped a UNMISS convoy at gunpoint and beat the unit's commander in Juba.

ACTOR1: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Non-violent activity: SPLA-IO rebels reportedly chased away UNMISS who had come to deliver aid to Lasu county. No mentioned clashes. Date unclear - report dated 8 August.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MSF: Doctors Without Borders
NOTES: A group of 6-10 gunmen carried out an armed robbery on an MSF clinic in Pibor, Boma state, leaving two MSF staff wounded. The raiders stole office equipment, including phones and computers. UNMISS peacekeepers intervened to force the attackers to retreat. MSF was forced to relocate some of its staff.

ACTOR1: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Exchange of fire between SPLA and UNMISS peacekeepers outside an IDP camp in Bentiu, Unity state. UNMISS said its peacekeepers prevented the abduction of IDPs by the soldiers.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Non-violent activity: On 13 June, SPLA soldiers denied a UN aircraft permission to take off from the Pochala airfield, citing grievances over the non-payment of salaries, and temporarily held the aircraft, crew and passengers, who were released on 14 June. Most of the SPLA soldiers stationed in Rate, Pochala County, were said to have abandoned their barracks due to lack of food and salary arrears.

ACTOR1: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Non-violent activity: Japanese troops fully pulled out of UNMISS, after their government decided in March 2017 to end its peacekeeping mission in war-torn South Sudan. The Japenese contingent counted 350 troops and focused on road construction.

ACTOR1: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: Non-violent activity: The UN Security Council extended the mandate of UNISFA for another six months, until November 15. However, they stressed that the force might not be renewed again in November if efforts to establish the Abyei Area Administration and Council remain stalled.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: UNMISS' Temporary Operating Base (TOB) in Leer town in Unity came under small arms attack by unknown gunmen from the direction of the nearby Government-held town. UNMISS forces repelled the attack.

ACTOR1: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
SOURCE: UNMISS; Radio Tamazuj; Eye Radio (South Sudan)
NOTES: Movement of forces: 14 top Commanders of the Regional Protection Force have arrived in South Sudan as part of the deployment process of 4,000 regional troops adding to the 13,000 UN peacekeepers already in South Sudan. Land was allocated in Jubek state, along the Juba-Yei road, to accomodate the full force. A first batch of forces was deployed end April, a second mid-August, and the rest expected to follow soon after. The force is mandated to protect key installations, facilitate the delivery of humanitarian assistance, and use all means to protect civilians including military means to respond to armed groups deemed to be attacking the other. President Kiir recalled 26 March that he would reject the deployment of any troop from outside the region.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
ACTOR2: Civilians (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Uniformed soldiers beat and harassed 11 IDPs at a farm in an IDP camp in Bentiu and attempted to abduct them. UNMISS intervened to rescue the IDPs. In otehr related events on the same day, UNMISS intervened and prevented the harassment and possible abduction of nearly 40 other IDPs returning to the site from the surrounding area.

ACTOR1: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Non-violent activity: The UN Security Council renewed UNMISS for another year and expanded its mandate, deciding that the mission shall use all necessary means to deter and prevent sexual violence within its capacityand 'monitor, investigate and report incidents of hate speech in the country. The mission will also maintain a troop ceiling of 17,000, including a 4,000-strong Regional Protection Force (RPF).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (South Sudan)
NOTES: Unknown gunmen attacked SPLA barracks in Ezo county but were repulsed by the government forces supported by UNMISS and fled after looting several properties. At least six rebels were killed, and hundreds of civilians were displaced.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (South Sudan)
NOTES: Unknown gunmen attacked SPLA in Bentiu at a checkpoint near the UN Base but were repulsed by government and UNMISS forces. Two soldiers were reportedly killed and at least ten civilians wounded in the attack.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Clashes reported between unidentified armed group and police national security service at the Juba-Yei road checkpoint north of a UN PoC site. UNMISS deployed a Quick Reaction Force to prevent the perpetrators from entering the POC site, forcing the attackers to withdraw.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
SOURCE: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Sudan Tribune; CTSAMM
NOTES: Unidentified assailants attacked an SSNPS checkpoint at the Juba-Yei road near a UN PoC site leaving a police officer injured. UNMISS deployed a Quick Reaction Force to prevent the perpetrators from entering the POC site, forcing the attackers to withdraw.

ACTOR1: Rioters (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: UNMISS used teargas to disperse IDPs who were protesting and threatening aid workers at the UNMISS Tomping site as the new IDP leadership attempted to prevent their relocation to a UN House.

ACTOR1: Rioters (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-); Civilians (International)
NOTES: Four UNMISS staff members (one international, three nationals) were physically assaulted by youth protestors in Bor, following a speech by the local governor.

ACTOR1: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
ACTOR2: Civilians (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan)
NOTES: Non-violent activity: UNMISS forces reportedly fired teargas on civilians with little or no warning as they reportedly struggled to manage an approximate 5,000 IDPs having fled the POC1 site to seek shelter from gunfire at the core UN house base. Peacekeepers had reportedly left their posts in POC1 the day before amid fighting and the IDPs were left with no protection.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
SOURCE: Centre for Civilians in Conflict; UNSC; AP
NOTES: In the course of fighting between SPLA and SPLA-IO forces near the UN base in Jubas Jebel area, the two parties fired indiscriminately. A large number of bullets, high-calibre weapons and shells struck the two POC sites in the UN base, leaving at least 50 civilians inside the POC sites killed between 10-12 July, including around 30 on the 10th, more than 160 injured, including UN staff, and causing significant property destruction, including to International Medical Corps maternity ward and to the tents of many NGOs operating in the base. In the course of the fighting, two Chinese peacekeepers were also killed and another six peacekeepers were injured by shelling while patrolling in the vicinity of the UN Jebel HQ on 10 July.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Unknown group killed one civilian at the gates of the UNMISS camp in Bentiu.

ACTOR2: Civilians (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: IDP shot and wounded at UNs PoC site in Juba.

ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On 25 April 2016, two rocket propelled grenades (RPG) were fired towards the UNMISS base in Bentiu. One of them landed outside inside UNMISS base and another inside. No fatalities or injuries.

NOTES: At least 29 killed over two days inside UN protection site in Malakal after fighting between Dinka and Shilluk displaced communities. UNMISS police used tear gas. Fatalitiies included 3 MSF staff. During fighting between Dinka and Shilluk militia, SPLA soldiers entered camp on night of Feb 18 and attacked Shilluk and Nuer IDPs, burning tents and killing civilians. Fatalities reported are result of both Dinka-Shilluk fighting and by military violence against civilians. Therefore, 10 fatalities coded for Feb 17 battle, 10 coded for Feb 18 battle, and 9 coded for Feb 18 violence against civilians.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
ACTOR2: Civilians (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Members of the South Sudanese NSS arrested a UNMISS staff member working in the civil affairs division at the Old market in Torit over suspicion of supporting or being in contact with SPLA-IO, and transferred him to a detention faciliity in Juba. In June 2015 he was transferred to the NSS headquarters in Jebel. As of 14 December 2016, he remained detained without charge, and his family unaware of his whereabouts. He has been reportedly subjected to torture and other ill-treatment while in detention.

In early 2015 he was transferred to the NSS headquarters in Jebel, and transferred back to Juba early 2016. As of 14 December 2016, he remained detained without charge. He has been reportedly subjected to torture and other ill-treatment while in detention.

NOTES: National Security Service forces detained 2 national UNMISS staff, including a security guard and a journalist from Radio Miraya, in Wau, reportedly accusing them of having links with rebels. The security guard was taken to Juba the next day and initially detained at the NSS riverside detention facility. In early 2015, he was transferred to the NSS headquarters in Jebel, and in January 2016, he was transferred back to the NSS riverside detention facility. Any access to him has been denied since December 2015. He has allegedly been subjected to torture or other ill treatment while in NSS detention.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of South Sudan (2011-); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Up to 8,000 members of the Lou Nuer militia raided villages in Pibor county to attack members of the Murle tribe, reportedly recovering dozens of abducted children and thousands of cattle stolen in August. No report of causalities, though there has been many since their fighting began in June 2011. SPLA and UNMISS allegedly sent reinforcements to Pibor to repel the attackers, however fighting continued. 30 reported killed.

ACTOR1: Twic Clan Militia (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Dinka Ethnic Militia (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 20 August 2023, twenty suspected Twic Dinka from Warrap attacked three villages in the disputed Abyei area, and included Majbong (coded to the nearest village Anet), Abathok and Agok (coded separately). Four people were killed and five were injured and 119 women and children were displaced (the victims of the attack are presumed to be Ngok Dinka). The attackers also fired at UNISFA peacekeepers and injured three. Fatalities split between three events, coded as 2.

NOTES: Looting: On 4 April 2022, overnight, an unidentified armed group looted the assets of the UNAMID mission headquarters in El Fasher (Al Fasher locality, North Darfur).

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 6 March 2022, an unknown group fired upon UNISFA peacekeepers near the airstrip at Agok in the disputed Abyei area. There were no casualties. The ambush follows a similar incident that took place on the previous day.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 5 March 2022, an unknown group fired upon a UNISFA convoy in Agok in the disputed Abyei area, without causing any injuries. The source notes that on the same day as the ambush, UNISFA had received a letter from the 'Twic Council of Traditional Chiefs' dated 23 February, which warned UNISFA against conducted patrols in disputed areas south of the Kiir River, although it is not confirmed that Twic Dinka were involved in this ambush.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Dinka Ethnic Militia (Sudan); Ngok Clan Militia (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 14 February 2022, around 80 Ngok Dinka youths forcibly entered the UNISFA HQ in Abyei town in the disputed Abyei area, demanding that UNISFA cancel the contracts of any Twic Dinka employees. The youths threw stones, and forced their way into the compound, damaging unspecified property, prompting UNISFA peacekeepers to fire rounds in the air. Ten of the youths were wounded, as were three members of UNISFA (note that the source does not specify whether the UNISFA wounded were peacekeepers or other personnel).

NOTES: Looting: On 10 January 2022, overnight, security forces (military and police), RSF, and unspecified rebel groups (coded as Darfur Communal Militia), and other unspecified rebel groups (presumed to be signatories to the Juba Peace Agreement), looted the assets of the UNAMID mission headquarters in El Fasher (Al Fasher locality, North Darfur).

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-); Labor Group (Sudan)
NOTES: On 8 October 2021, dozens of former employees of the UNAMID mission gathered at the organization's headquarters in El Fasher (Al Fasher locality, North Darfur state), demanding that pension contributions, end-of-service pay, and insurance monies owed.

The soldiers are reported to now be in El Fasher in North Darfur. UPDATE: On May 6, information emerged suggesting that 119 Tigrayan ENDF soldiers serving with the (departing) UNAMID mission in Darfur have also requested asylum.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: On 1 January 2021, unidentified militiamen attempted to break into the UNAMID compound in Zalingei (Central Darfur state), and are described as having 'besieged' the premises (reportedly in a bid to loot material from the outgoing mission). There is no further information at this time.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ACTOR2: Government of Sudan (2019-)
NOTES: Agreement: On 31 December 2020, the mandate for the UNAMID peacekeeping force expired, and the planned (phased) drawdown of peacekeepers and infrastructure began. Peacekeeping patrols are also to finish. The mission will be replaced with the United Nations Integrated Transition Assistance Mission, which will focus on mediation, peacebuilding and providing assistance to transitional authorities in Khartoum, as responsibility for security in Darfur is transferred to state forces. The withdrawal has sparked demonstrations in several IDP camps in Darfur, with the region continuing to experience recurrent violence, albeit at lower levels than at the height of the war in Darfur.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 2 December 2020, an unspecified armed group clashed with UNISFA peacekeepers close to Doungab in the disputed Abyei (approximate coordinates based on UNISFA map used at GP2), after the armed group fired upon the peacekeepers. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR2: Civilians (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 13 July 2020, an unidentified armed man fired upon a UNISFA vehicle in Kadugli (South Kordofan state), killing a Sudanese employee of the mission, amid tensions over the Abyei area. The attacker then fled the scene.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 24 June 2020, unknown attackers fired upon a UNISFA vehicle in between Goli and Todach in the disputed Abyei area (coordinates for intermediate location of Thothok used at GP2), wounding three soldiers (one seriously). The attack comes amid deteriorating security in the area.

ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)

Reports suggest that both police as well as IDPs were involved in the looting, which ended after RSF paramilitaries arrived.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Looting: Around 15 December 2019 (month of), looters ransacked the UNAMID base at Otash IDP Camp (Nyala Shimal locality, South Darfur state). There is no further information.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 19 August 2019, armed youths attacked a UNIFSA patrol (who appear to have been attempting to also arrest a suspect) at Dari market in the Northern Sector of Abyei (coordinates for Diffra, Abyei area, used at prec2). One peacekeeper was injured and a Misseriya man killed during the clash.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Communal Militia (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 16 July 2019, unknown gunmen attacked Amiet Market (Abyei) killing six civilians, including a baby, and looting a small number of cattle. A UNSIFA patrol intervened, and the gunmen killed one peacekeeper and seriously wounded another. Subsequent reports imply the attackers were cattle raiders from South Sudan, and have been coded as such.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 28 June 2019, unidentified gunmen fired at a UNIFSA patrol at Gung Garang in the Central Sector of Abyei. There were no injuries.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AU: African Union
ACTOR2: Government of Sudan (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-2023) Rapid Support Forces
NOTES: On 14 June 2019, UNAMID announced it was suspending the transfer of its facilities to the Sudanese authorities as part of its withdrawal process, following a govt decree on June 13th that UNAMID camps should be handed over to RSF paramilitaries. Subsequently, the AU agreed to extend the mandate for UNAMID for a further year. UPDATE: On June 26th, the UNSC extended UNAMID until 31st October, and delayed the planned draw-down of the mission.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Sudan (2019-); Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Aid Workers (International); Aid Workers (Sudan)
NOTES: On 14 May 2019, looters (including police and military personnel) raided the Sector West HQ of UNAMID in El Geneina (West Darfur), which was about to be turned over to local authortities as part of the planned draw-down. Equipment was looted and property vandalised, though there were no reports of injuries (Ethiopian peacekeepers separated UNAMID staff from the looters). On May 12th and 13th, unknown looters (coded as UAG) raided national and international NGOs in Buram town, and again on May 28t in Kalma IDP camp.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: On 20 December 2018, UNAMID announced that it had completed the withdrawal of its forces from the ten sites in Darfur it had earmarked for closure (with the final site to be closed being in Gereida, South Darfur). The sites are to be transferred to the government of Sudan, for non-military purposes. This move comes as the UN mission draws down the number of personnel it has stationed in Darfur.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ACTOR2: Government of Sudan (1989-2019)
NOTES: On October 4th and 8th, UNAMID forces handed two IDP sites in Al Salam and El Sereif (South and North Darfur) to the Sudanese government. The Al Salam site, which was being used as a centre for community police, will retain this function under the control of the Sudanese police (in conjunction with local elders), whilst the El Sereif site will assume a new role as a community centre and technical college. Further team sites will be transferred over the remainder of 2018.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: UNSC approves the extension of UNAMID mandate by one year, as well as the controversial reduction of personnel (from 8,735 to 4,050 personnel, with police being unchanged at 2,500 personnel). Most UNAMID sites to close in Darfur, and HQ will be transferred to Golo. However, troop reductions are contingent on improving security.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: UNAMID mandate extended by one year. The forces will be reduced from 8,735 to 5,470 military personnel by the end of 2018, and down to 4,050 by June 30th 2019. The remaining forces will be limited to the greater Jebel Marrah area. The headquarters of the mission will also shift from El Fasher (North Darfur) to Zalingei (Central Darfur).

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ACTOR2: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Rapid Support Forces
NOTES: A number of rebel groups have accused UNAMID of handing over two of its former bases in Maleet and Malha areas of North Darfur to the RSF, breaching the Status of Forces Agreement (SOFA) signed between the Government of Sudan (GoS) and the UN mission. The UNSC has recently agreed to scale down UNAMID's operations in Sudan.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-); Aid Workers (Sudan)
NOTES: Looting: Unidentified gunmen threatened and robbed a UN peacekeeping mission employee in El Fasher of her vehicle and phones at gunpoint on 6 August. Similar incident the following day, when gunmen hijacked an aid vehicle in the town. The Vice-President was present in the city to launch a campaign to collect weapons and arrest criminals who exploit four-wheel-drive unlicensed vehicles. A week later, on 13 August, masked gunmen raided a charity centre in Kabkabiya in North Darfur, seizing an ambulance and a number of devices.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: On 30 June 2017, an unknown armed assailant raided 43 cattle belonging to a Misseriya herder at Sink, in Sector North of Abyei. The assailant killed one person and injured another. UNISFA troops were dispatched to the area and exchanged fire with the assailant, who abandoned the cattle and fled. The cattle were handed over to the Misseriya owner.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: Looting: UNISFA chased a group of armed assailants who robbed and hijacked a car at the Amiet common market in Abyei, seizing one rocket-propelled grenade launcher and recovering the vehicle and money stolen. No report of fire exchange.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: The African Union Peace and Security Council of (AUPSC) extended UNAMID's mandate for 12 months. The Council decided to reduce by nearly a half the strength of the mission, and change its mandate from a peacekeeping to a peacebuilding operation. A week later, the UN Security Council confirmed the mission's year-long extension and reduction of police and military personnel by 30% and 44% respectively from 31 January 2018.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Ten UNAMID soldiers were injured when their patrol vehicle drove on an UXO in Al-Tina locality in North Darfur.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Unknown gunmen shot and kille a Nigerian UNAMID soldier in downtown Nyala, South Darfur. The assailants left with his vehicle.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNHCR: United Nations Refugee Agency
NOTES: On 3 May 2017, armed men in military attire on board a Toyota Land Cruiser vehicle attempted to carjack a minibus belonging to the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees near the World Food Programme warehouse in Nyala. The perpetrators fled the scene following the intervention of UNAMID troops escorting the vehicle. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) Military Intelligence Service
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Arrests: On 20 and 30 April, Military Intelligence detained three peacekeepers for allegedly taking pictures of the local SAF headquarters and being present in a restricted military area. All three peacekeepers were released immediately. On 28 May, a UNAMID national staff member was arrested by the National Intelligence and Security Services in Ed Daein for alleged corruption.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019) National Intelligence and Security Services
NOTES: More than 50 former UNAMID staff launched a three-day sit-in strike in El Fasher to demand financial rights for dismissed workers. On the second day, NISS dispersed the protesters, taking them to their office.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: More than 50 former UNAMID staff launched a three-day sit-in strike in El Fasher to demand financial rights for dismissed workers. On the second day, NISS dispersed the protesters, taking them to their office.

ACTOR1: Hamid Ali Militia
ACTOR2: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-2019); UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Heavy shooting erupted when government forces prevented members of the Hamid Ali militia from entering Zalingei to protest delays in salary payment. During the violence, one member of the Arab militia was killed and three stray bullets hit UNAMID facilities, without injuring peacekeepers.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Dozens of former local UNAMID staff protested in front of the mission's headquarters in El-Faher for alleged non-payment of financial dues since 2010. Similar protests were held early 2017 and in 2016.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Looting: Gunmen ambushed a convoy escorting Sudan's Second Vice-President on his way to open a health centre at El Zariba district east of Kutum, hijacking a UNAMID vehicle while the rest of the convoy escaped. Sudanese forces recovered the vehicle later.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Dozens of former local UNAMID staff protested in front of the mission's premises in El-Fasher for alleged non-payment of financial dues since 2010. Similar protests were held in 2016.

ACTOR1: Arab Ethnic Militia (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Non-violent activity: Residents from the Kalma IDP camp in South Darfur were ambushed by the assailants that they were tracking after cattle raids, leaving 1 killed and another injured. The following day, a UNAMID patrol took the wounded man to a police station, where they were surrounded by armed Arabs who fired shots in the air. SAF and police were dispatched to the area.

ACTOR1: Arab Ethnic Militia (Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-); Fur Ethnic Group (Sudan)
NOTES: On 18 December 2016, Arab nomads assaulted a UNAMID truck driver belonging to the Fur tribe at a water point in Kube near the Sortony IDP camp. They subsequently warned Fur from the camp that they should not collect water in Kube.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Dozens of former UNAMID local staff protested in front of the mission's premises in El-Fasher, Nyala, El Geneina and Zalingei in Darfur, for non-payment of pension entitlements since 2010. UNAMID declared that a majority of the payments had been made while the rest were being finalised, and denounced movement blockades by the protesters affecting UNAMID staffs access to camps and to their workplaces.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Dozens of former UNAMID local staff protested in front of the mission's premises in El-Fasher, Nyala, El Geneina and Zalingei in Darfur, for non-payment of pension entitlements since 2010. UNAMID declared that a majority of the payments had been made while the rest were being finalised, and denounced movement blockades by the protesters affecting UNAMID staffs access to camps and to their workplaces.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Dozens of former UNAMID local staff protested in front of the mission's premises in El-Fasher, Nyala, El Geneina and Zalingei in Darfur, for non-payment of pension entitlements since 2010. UNAMID declared that a majority of the payments had been made while the rest were being finalised, and denounced movement blockades by the protesters affecting UNAMID staffs access to camps and to their workplaces.

ACTOR1: Rioters (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Dozens of former UNAMID local staff protested in front of the mission's premises in El-Fasher, Nyala, El Geneina and Zalingei in Darfur, for non-payment of pension entitlements since 2010. UNAMID declared that a majority of the payments had been made while the rest were being finalised, and denounced movement blockades by the protesters affecting UNAMID staffs access to camps and to their workplaces.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Gunmen abducted four Sudanese working for UNAMID near Nyala Technical College, while on their way to the missions headquarters in Sagra, north east of Nyala. They looted their vehicles. They were released hours later.

ACTOR1: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: The U.N. Interim Security Force of Abyei mandate was extended to 15 May 2017, with the Security Council demanding South Sudan and Sudan to urgently establish an Abyei Area Administration and Council, as well as a police service that would protect oil infrastructure.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Refugees/IDPs (Sudan); Women (Sudan)
NOTES: A UNAMID vehicle ran over a girl near the Abbasi IDP camp in Mellit, North Darfur, and did not stop after the accident, allegedly due to lack of an interpreter among them. The deceaseds family filed a complaint to police authorities and protested at the UNAMID headquarters in the locality over the accident and the refusal of the UNAMID patrol to stop.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: Unknown gunmen fired machine guns and rocket-propelled grenades near the UNISFA Tajalei operating base in Abyei.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Strikes: UNAMID staff go on strike and demand a retroactive salary adjustment, as well as other employment-related issues.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Looting: 16 unidentified armed men attacked two UNAMID security individual contractors guarding a water point in Labado, East Darfur, robbing them of their belongings and stealing a generator.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: Unknown gunmen opened fire on a commercial pickup vehicle in Kolom area transporting traders from Warrap State, South Sudan, to the common market at Noong, Abyei, killing three and wounding two seriously. The gunmen also exchanged fire with a UNISFA patrol responding to the incident, which later arrested two suspects.

ACTOR1: Protesters (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: UNAMID employees protest over non-payment of dues.

ACTOR1: Rizeigat Ethnic Militia (Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-); Refugees/IDPs (Sudan); Women (Sudan)
SOURCE: Radio Dabanga; Amnesty International; Sudan Tribune; UNAMID
NOTES: Following earlier clashes at the market, unknown group attacked Sortony camp, targeting civilians. At least 6 killed in two attacks (3 killed in clashes earlier at market 300m from Sortony, 3 killed inside camp later in the day), several wounded including a UNAMID peacekeeper from the nearby base. 2 attackers arrested by UNAMID. Reports that militiamen also raped two women and abducted 2 others during the attacks.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-); Women (Sudan)
NOTES: Militia rape girl in Terra El Madrasa, 5kms west of Tawila. UNAMID peacekeepers later arrested 3 suspects.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: WFP: World Food Programme
NOTES: Unknown group fired on a WFP relief convoy en route from Kutum to Kabkabia, 40km from Kutum. UNAMID soldiers from South Africa fought back. 1 peacekeeper killed, 1 attacker killed.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Looting: Armed men in uniform rob the UNAMID residence in Dereiga.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified armed group attacked a UNAMID patrol in El Daein, hijacking the vehicle.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Armed group attacked UNAMID peacekeeping soldiers in Anka. One injured, weapons seized.

ACTOR1: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: SLM/AW attacked a UNAMID patrol 31km north east of Kutum. UNAMID killed 1 and injured 2 SLA/AW members. 5 weapons were seized.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Pastoralists (Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: Herdsmen kill 2 in Miokol Alei village east of Abyei. UNISFA deployed.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Ngok Clan Group (Sudan); Civilians (Ethiopia); UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-); Students (Sudan); Teachers (Sudan)
NOTES: Ngok Dinka chiefs home and a primary school shelled by unknown group in Abyei. One girl killed, one Ethiopian peacekeeper killed.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of South Africa (1994-); WFP: World Food Programme
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
NOTES: South African soldier from UNAMID killed and 1 injured in ambush by unknown group on road between Mellit and Almaliha.

ACTOR1: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: SRF: Sudan Revolutionary Front
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: SPLA/M-IO and SRF fired 4 rocket bombs on Abyei, UNISFA fired back.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Gunmen abduct UNAMID worker, released on July 26.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Gunfire between unknown armed group and UNAMID patrol in Bowa Turmes village, 18kms northwest of UNAMIDs site in Kutum. No injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Gunmen shot and wounded a Sudanese driver of a UNAMID bus in Nyala.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified perpetrators fire shots from 500m at UNAMID personnel. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified perpetrators fire mortars at UNAMID targets at Tullus. No reported injury.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ACTOR2: Protesters (Sudan)
NOTES: A second day of protests at UNAMID base in Kass. Foreign Ministry claims UNAMID fired on protesters, killing a second protester.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
NOTES: UNAMID patrol travelling from Nyala attacked by gunmen near Kas. 4 peacekeepers injured.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ACTOR2: Protesters (Sudan)
NOTES: Protests at UNAMID base in Kass, protesting against clashes between UNAMID and Zaghawa militia occurring earlier in the day. Foreign Ministry claims UNAMID fired on the protesters, killing one.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ACTOR2: Zaghawa Ethnic Militia (Sudan)
NOTES: Clashes between UNAMID troops and 40 Zaghawa militia attempting to steal cattle and vehicles on the road between Kass and Shangita, 86km west of Nyala. 5 killed.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: UNAMID worker from Ethiopia injured and killed in Mujkar, West Darfur.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Three militiamen intercepted a UNAMID vehicle in Nyala, ordered the passengers to disembark at gunpoint, and abducted the driver. He was released later that day.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers fire three shot at UNAMID personnel in Tullus. No reported causalities.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: An unidentified group fires mortar rounds from 400m at UNAMID forces. No reported causalities.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: WFP: World Food Programme
NOTES: Joint UNAMID and WFP convoy of 30 vehicles en route from Kutum to Al Fasher attacked by militiamen, 36km south of Kutum. UNAMID exchanged fire with the unidentified group. 1 injured.

ACTOR1: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
ACTOR2: Misseriya Ethnic Militia (Sudan)
NOTES: On 2 March 2015, UNISFA peacekeepers clashed with Misseriya militia at Shegeg in the disputed Abyei area, after Misseriya earlier attacked the Ngok Dinka village of Marial Achak. Three Misseriya were killed, and four arrested.

ACTOR1: Misseriya Ethnic Militia (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: Misseriya tribesmen with machine guns attacked UNISFA forces in Mayankor area, 10km from Abyei. 11 arrested.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (International)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: 2 Russian pilots working as UNAMID contractors in Sudan were kidnapped on Jan 29 when six armed gunmen in cars blocked a UNAMID minibus in Zalingei and took the passengers in an unknown direction. They were freed in Khartoum on June 6.

ACTOR1: Government of Sudan (1989-2019)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Non-violent activity: UNAMID, Government of Sudan, Darfur Regional Authority, and Darfur civil society organizations launched the Darfur Internal Dialogue and Consulation process in Al Fasher.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified gunmen launched two attacks on UNAMID peacekeepers near their base at Khor Abeche. There were 15 attackers, 2 of whom were killed, while no peacekeepers were wounded. The attackers seized a water tanker and a vehicle.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified gunmen launched an attack on UNAMID peacekeepers at Habila. No reported causalities.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: A Sudanese driver working for the UNISFA was kidnapped by unidentified armed men.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: 3 Pakistani UNAMID peacekeepers were wounded in an attack by unidentified armed men. They attempted to steal the peacekeepers vehicle but were repulsed.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: An unidentified armed group ambushed two military vehicles belonging to UNAMID in the Ghrabshi area of the county of Nateega in South Darfur and stole their vehicles and weapons. No injuries were reported but gunfire did occur.

ACTOR1: JEM-Sudan: Justice and Equality Movement (Sudan Faction)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: JEM-PF: Justice and Equality Movement (Peace Faction); SLM/A-MWF: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Mother Wing Faction); SLM/A-Terab: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Mustafa Terab Faction)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Agreement: 500 ex-combatants from JEM-Sudan, SLA-Mustafa Terab, SLA-Mother Wing, and JEM-Peace Wing have officially begun the demobilization process with the Sudan Disarmament, Demobilisation and Reintegration Commission (SDDRC).

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ACTOR2: Militia (Pro-Government)
NOTES: 4 landcruisers full of pro-government militia attacked a UNAMID force protecting a water tanker. 2 South African UNAMID members (peacekeeper/driver) were seriously injured. The militiamen also injured a young boy with a stray bullet as they left.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
NOTES: 3 Ethiopian UNAMID peacekeepers were killed and 4 others abducted in the Korma locality near the Shoba Basic School. 2 were shot and killed instantly, 1 was wounded and died later, and the vehicle along with 4 other peacekeepers were seized during the attack.

ACTOR1: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (South Sudan)
NOTES: Attackers who had attacked a Dinka Ngok cattle camp at Gong e Mou area were ambushed by a UNIFSA patrol at Wun e Ruok. Some sources reported that the attackers were SAF, others blamed the attacks on Misseriya nomads and pro-Khartoum South Sudan United Movement.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Looting: Militia elements intercepted and stole a UNAMID vehicle in Jebel Sigaira, 8m NE of Nyala.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: UNAMID teams stationed at the Fata Borno and Kassab camps moved their bases to Kutum town

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ACTOR2: Militia (Pro-Government)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Arab Ethnic Militia (Sudan)
NOTES: One peacekeeper was killed and three others were wounded in a gun battle. Arab militia elements were initially identified as responsible, but later reports identified Janjaweed militia

ACTOR2: Civilians (Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Militia forces raided Tawila for the displaced, reportedly searching for rebels, assaulting & robbing citizens. When UNAMID forces expelled them from town, militia fired into the air

ACTOR1: Militia (Pro-Government)

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Militiamen stormed Kalma camp for the displaced in Nyala locality, South Darfur, reportedly searching for stolen sheep. UNAMID responded but fled when militia fired into the air.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified gunmen attacked a UNAMID patrol near Sindy, about halfway between the North Darfur towns of Malha & Mellit. The gunmen retreated after a firefight.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Armed men abducted an international contractor working at UNAMID, in El Fasher. He was freed on June 12 2014 after 94 days in captivity.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Soth African UNAMID peacekeepers were ambushed and robbed of equipment in Millet, North Darfur.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: 2 UNAMID peacekeepers killed. Peacekeepers were from Jordan and Senegal.

ACTOR1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-2019)
ACTOR2: Unidentified Armed Group (Sudan)
NOTES: The members of the Security Council condemned in the strongest terms the attack by unidentified armed assailants on an African Union-United Nations Hybrid Operation in Darfur (UNAMID) patrol near Kabkabiya, North Darfur, on 24 November, which resulted in the death of one Rwandan peacekeeper.

ACTOR1: JEM: Justice and Equality Movement
ACTOR2: Government of Sudan (1989-2019)
